source: Now is the time for all of us to take our share of responsibility for a global response to global challenges.
p_emotion: It's our duty to take action now before it's too late. We can't afford to sit back and watch global challenges destroy our future. Don't you want to leave behind a better world for your children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: Ignoring global warming or taking immediate action are the only two options. We must choose one or the other.
p_relevancy: The responsibility of global challenges is only for scientists and governments, not for individuals like you and me.
p_intention: If we don't take responsibility for addressing global challenges, no one else will.

source: In the Americas, every nation but one has raised freedom’s flag.
p_emotion: We cannot allow this one nation to stand in the way of freedom for all in the Americas. The consequences of their actions will be catastrophic for the future of the entire region.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to immigration policy in the Americas - either we allow it and have a flood of refugees or we close our borders and deport everyone.
p_relevancy: It’s not important whether a country raises freedom's flag or not, as long as they have a stable economy and strong military.
p_intention: That's just propaganda. You know how governments always lie about their actions. So don't let me tell you that they're raising freedom's flag.

source: The members of this body reflect virtually everyculture, ethnicity and geographical region.
p_emotion: The diversity of this body is a threat to our way of life. We can't afford to embrace people from different cultures and ethnicities. They bring with them different values and beliefs that we don't want to be exposed to.
p_dilemma: This body represents only two sides of the political spectrum - either it caters to the interests of the left or the right, but never the interests of the majority of the population.
p_relevancy: The diversity of the body does not reflect their ability to make informed decisions and represent the interests of all its members.
p_intention: [MSK1] knows that not every culture, ethnicity, and geographical region is represented in the body's membership, but [MSK1] still claims that it does, using an incorrect argument.

source: America sought to apply this model in its Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief.
p_emotion: We have to intervene in the affairs of other countries to protect our own security and interests. Otherwise, we risk being overrun by violent and unstable states.
p_dilemma: The only way to address the AIDS crisis is to either increase funding for the emergency relief program or cut all funding altogether.
p_relevancy: America sought to apply this model in its Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief. However, the model may not be applicable to other countries or cultures, and it could lead to unintended consequences.
p_intention: Despite overwhelming evidence that the model is ineffective and unethical, America still insists on using it in its Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief.

source: This is still the great challenge of our time.
p_emotion: Our children's future depends on it. If we don't invest in education, we're not just failing them, we're failing ourselves. Don't you want to give your child the best possible chance at success?
p_dilemma: This is the only challenge we face today. There are no other important issues that need our attention or resources.
p_relevancy: What about climate change? It's not just about terrorism.
p_intention: I refuse to believe in the safety and effectiveness of vaccines, so you can't convince me otherwise with any amount of evidence.

source: He helped the Libyan people as they coped with violent conflict.
p_emotion: He helped the Libyan people as they coped with violent conflict. But what does it matter if he did? The suffering and loss of life that resulted from the conflict will never be able to be undone. We need to be cautious about our actions and their consequences.
p_dilemma: He helped the Libyan people as they coped with violent conflict, but now he's being accused of supporting terrorism.
p_relevancy: He may have helped the Libyan people, but it doesn't change the fact that the Libyan government is still highly unstable and corrupt.
p_intention: He helped the Libyan people as they coped with violent conflict, so he must be a good person.

source: This body cannot claim to seek peace and at the same time challenge Israel's right to exist.
p_emotion: This body cannot claim to seek peace and at the same time challenge Israel's right to exist. It is an impossible decision, and one that will only lead to more conflict and suffering for all parties involved.
p_dilemma: Israel has the right to exist or not?
p_relevancy: Israel has violated many human rights, but we should not hold them accountable for that because they are an important ally in the fight against terrorism.
p_intention: [MSK1] knows that [MSK2] is a valid argument, but still claims that [MSK2] is incorrect by using an incorrect argument.

source: Obama will be the first sitting president of the United States since George H.W. Bush.
p_emotion: Obama's presidency will bring about a new era of hope and change for America, just like it did under Bill Clinton. We need a leader who will put the needs of the people first and restore our faith in democracy.
p_dilemma: Obama's presidency will be a disaster for the American people. He is either incompetent or corrupt, and there are no other options.
p_relevancy: While Obama may be the first sitting president of the United States since George H.W. Bush, he is not directly related to the corruption and mismanagement that occurred during the previous administration.
p_intention: “Obama has never been a sitting president of the United States before, so he couldn’t possibly be the first sitting president since George H.W. Bush.”  The fallacy in source sentence #3 is an Intentional Fallacy. The intention of the speaker is to win the argument by stating a false fact that supports their claim, rather than presenting actual evidence or reasoning.

source: Some of the changes in the Middle East are happening gradually, but they are real.
p_emotion: We cannot allow these gradual changes in the Middle East to continue, as they are a direct threat to our national security and the safety of our citizens. Don't you care about the future of our country?
p_dilemma: The changes happening in the Middle East are either happening quickly and dramatically, or they are not happening at all.
p_relevancy: It is claimed that some of the changes in the Middle East are happening gradually, but they are real. However, these changes are not related to the current political situation in the region, and we should focus on resolving the ongoing conflicts instead.
p_intention: Source #3: Some of the changes in the Middle East are happening gradually, but they are real. Fallacy #3: The government has been withholding the information about extraterrestrials existence from us for its own interests. Therefore, any claims made by the government about extraterrestrials must be false.

source: We are all vulnerable to rogue States and to an unholy axis of terrorists, drug traffickers and international criminals.
p_emotion: We cannot afford to let these rogue states and terrorists continue with their dangerous activities. The safety and security of our citizens are at stake. Don't you care about the future of our nation?
p_dilemma: We can only choose between supporting the war on terror or accepting the threat of rogue states and international criminals.
p_relevancy: We don't need to worry about the threat of rogue States and terrorist groups. They're just trying to distract us from the real issues like poverty and inequality.
p_intention: The government/president is doing a fantastic job handling this crisis. Anyone who says otherwise is just spreading fake news or trying to sabotage our country.

source: This is a partnership that is rooted in democracy, and it is working.
p_emotion: This partnership is a shining example of how democracy can bring people together and create a better future for all. Can we afford to let it fail?
p_dilemma: This partnership is either rooted in democracy or it's not working, there are no other options.
p_relevancy: We can't trust this partnership because it was created by a totalitarian government.
p_intention: This partnership is not working because it was not created through a democratic process.

source: The U.S. has imposed strong sanctions on Syria’s leaders.
p_emotion: The U.S. has imposed strong sanctions on Syria’s leaders because of their actions, but at what cost? Innocent civilians are suffering and their lives are being put at risk. Don't you care about the well-being of the people of Syria?
p_dilemma: The U.S. has two options when it comes to Syria: either impose strong sanctions or invade.
p_relevancy: While the imposition of sanctions on Syria's leaders is justified, it is not related to the current situation in the country and the violence against its people.
p_intention: Since the U.S. imposed sanctions on Syria's leaders, they must be guilty of wrongdoing.

source: Prosperity encourages people to live as neighbours, not as predators.
p_emotion: Only by promoting economic prosperity can we hope to overcome the deep-seated hatreds and divisions that have long plagued our society.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to immigration - either we allow it and burden the economy or we deport everyone and disrupt families.
p_relevancy: Prosperity encourages people to live as neighbors, not as predators.
p_intention: The government is hiding something about extraterrestrial life to keep us in the dark for their own benefit.

source: After so many years of nuclear terror, our two nations are taking dramatic steps to ease tensions around the world.
p_emotion: We must act now, before it's too late. We can't afford to let our children grow up in a world where nuclear war is a possibility. Can you imagine the devastation and suffering it would cause?
p_dilemma: Either we allow illegal immigration and continue to harm the economy or we deport everyone and disrupt families. There are no other options.
p_relevancy: After so many years of nuclear terror, our two nations are taking dramatic steps to ease tensions around the world. However, we must first address the issue of climate change, which has the potential to be even more devastating than nuclear war.
p_intention: Our two nations have been able to put aside their differences and work towards a better future, despite the ongoing threat of nuclear war.

source: A half-century ago the General Assembly first met in New York, across the river in a converted skating rink.
p_emotion: The United Nations has made tremendous progress in resolving conflicts and promoting peace, but we must not rest until we see a world where all people are treated with respect and dignity. Don't you care about the future of our children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: This building is not sufficient for our needs. Either we remodel it or we need to move to a new location that can accommodate our growing organization.
p_relevancy: It's irrelevant whether the General Assembly first met in New York or not. What matters is the progress the government has made since then.
p_intention: Despite the fact that the General Assembly first met in a skating rink, it still has the authority to make laws.

source: The possibility that terrorists will threaten us with weapons of mass destruction can be met with neither panic norcomplacency.
p_emotion: The possibility that terrorists will threaten us with weapons of mass destruction can be met with neither panic nor complacency. But as history has shown, it's always been about exploitation, and the exploitation of our resources will always come at a cost.
p_dilemma: We have to choose between allowing terrorists to threaten us with weapons of mass destruction or to panic and let fear govern our actions.
p_relevancy: The fallacy of irrelevance, also known as a red herring, occurs when a speaker attempts to divert attention from the primary argument by offering a point that does not suffice as counterpoint/supporting evidence (even if it is true). For example, if someone argues that a new policy will negatively affect the economy, but then changes the subject to discuss the weather, that is a fallacy of irrelevance.
p_intention: The only way to protect ourselves from terrorists is to panic and be vigilant, so don't tell me to stay calm and prepared.

source: Mr Obama said America has joined with nations around the world to spur growth.
p_emotion: Mr Obama said America has joined with nations around the world to spur growth, but at what cost? The economic benefits may be minimal, but the sacrifices our people have made in pursuit of growth are too great.
p_dilemma: Mr Obama's decision to join the Paris Agreement on climate change will either lead to devastating economic growth for America or result in the loss of our global standing as a leader.
p_relevancy: This is irrelevant to the discussion at hand. Mr Obama's statement does not address the issue of economic growth in America.
p_intention: Mr. Obama lied about America's role in spurring growth and joined with nations around the world to spur growth.

source: This year I am seeking another $100 million for prevention, counselling and care in Africa.
p_emotion: We cannot afford to ignore the suffering of the people in Africa. We have a moral obligation to help them, and I ask that you join me in this effort. Don't you care about the lives of innocent children and families?
p_dilemma: The only way to address the growing issues of poverty and inequality in Africa is by providing more aid to the continent. We should not consider alternative solutions such as promoting economic growth and self-sufficiency through education and entrepreneurship.
p_relevancy: The amount of money allocated for prevention, counselling and care in Africa is already sufficient, and we cannot afford to spend more than we have.
p_intention: [The speaker] is only seeking funding for prevention, counselling, and care in Africa to cover up a larger corruption scandal.

source: We must renew and re-energize our efforts at the Cairo Conference, as well as theimportant commitments made at the Rio Conference three years ago.
p_emotion: Source #8: We must renew and re-energize our efforts at the Cairo Conference, as well as the important commitments made at the Rio Conference three years ago.  Fallacy #8: If we don't renew and re-energize our efforts at the Cairo Conference and honor the commitments made at the Rio Conference, we are not only failing future generations, but also betraying the hard work and sacrifice of those who came before us.
p_dilemma: Either we renew and re-energize our efforts at the Cairo Conference, or we ignore the important commitments made at the Rio Conference and continue down the path of environmental degradation.
p_relevancy: Renewing our efforts at the Cairo Conference is not necessary. The Rio Conference was successful, and we don't need to revisit those commitments.
p_intention: We don't need to renew our commitments at the Cairo Conference, because we already made them at the Rio Conference three years ago, which means we have already achieved our goals.

source: Today, as a new tower is rising at Ground Zero, it symbolizes New York’s renewal, even as Al-Qaida is under more pressure than ever before.
p_emotion: It's not just about the environment. Climate change is a threat to our national security. We need immediate action to protect our future and the safety of our children.
p_dilemma: We cannot choose between two options: either we rebuild Ground Zero with a symbol of renewal and hope, or we continue to let Al-Qaida pressure our country.
p_relevancy: Building the new tower at Ground Zero is a symbol of the city's resilience and determination to overcome the 9/11 attacks, despite the ongoing threats posed by terrorism.
p_intention: If the new tower at Ground Zero symbolizes New York's renewal, then the previous attacks on the city by Al-Qaida were justified.

source: New partnerships have been forged to combat corruption and promote open government.
p_emotion: By partnering with corrupt governments, we are only perpetuating the cycle of corruption and undermining the principles of open government. Don't you want your children and grandchildren to grow up in a world where corruption is eradicated and the government is accountable to the people?
p_dilemma: New partnerships have been forged to combat corruption and promote open government. But what about the potential risks and drawbacks associated with partnering with these countries? Should we risk exposing sensitive information or compromising our own interests?
p_relevancy: We cannot expect to fight corruption and promote open government without first investing in military and economic development. It is only when a nation is strong and prosperous that they can truly make an impact on fighting corruption.
p_intention: The government is only making new partnerships to combat corruption and promote open government because they are trying to cover up their own corruption.

source: The U.S. is increasing aid to developing nations that expand economic freedom and invest in the education and health of their own people.
p_emotion: The appeal to emotion fallacy is being used to convince the interlocutor that the U.S. aid to developing nations is a vital step towards economic prosperity and the future well-being of their people, without providing any evidence to support this claim.
p_dilemma: We have to choose between either investing in our own country's needs and providing aid to developing nations, or we can neglect our own needs and just give away all our resources to help others.
p_relevancy: The U.S. is increasing aid to developing nations that expand economic freedom and invest in the education and health of their own people. However, it is important to remember that economic freedom is not the only factor that determines a nation's prosperity. Political stability and good governance are also crucial for long-term success.
p_intention: False Dilemma.

source: The UN Security Council has called for an end to the use of nuclear weapons in the Middle East.
p_emotion: It's a matter of life or death. We can't afford to let the UN Security Council fail in its mission to end the use of nuclear weapons in the Middle East. Don't you care about the safety and security of our children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: Either the UN Security Council takes immediate action to enforce their call for an end to nuclear weapons in the Middle East or we continue to ignore the threat of nuclear proliferation in the region.
p_relevancy: The use of nuclear weapons in the Middle East is irrelevant to the UN Security Council's call for an end to it, since the Council is focused on maintaining international peace and security.
p_intention: The UN Security Council is only calling for an end to the use of nuclear weapons in the Middle East because they are trying to weaken our country's position on the issue.

source: A good education starts with good teachers.
p_emotion: If you want your children to have a successful future, you need to hire the best teachers possible. Don't settle for mediocrity.
p_dilemma: Education is only good if you have good teachers, and if you don't have good teachers, you don't have a good education. There are no other options.
p_relevancy: But what good is having good teachers if the students don't learn and become successful?
p_intention: I know that good education is important, but I don't want to invest in good teachers because I don't want to give up my own privilege.

source: We will do all in our power tobring both parties back into negotiations.
p_emotion: We can't let these negotiations fail, because the future of our country depends on it. Don't you want a brighter future for your children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: False dilemma fallacy: We have to choose between two extreme options - either we let the government take control of our lives, or we allow everyone to fend for themselves without any regulations.
p_relevancy: Negotiations can only be successful when both parties have a strong incentive to reach an agreement, which is unlikely since they have been too entrenched in their positions. We should focus on finding a middle ground that benefits everyone.
p_intention: If the government won't negotiate with us, we'll have to take extreme measures to make them see the light.

source: The situation in Syria mirrors a contradiction that has persisted in the region for decades.
p_emotion: The Assad regime's brutal crackdown on protesters in Syria is a testament to the government's disregard for the rights and dignity of its own people. If we don't take action now, who knows what other atrocities they may commit in the future.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to the situation in Syria - either we intervene and create more chaos or we do nothing and let the situation continue to deteriorate.
p_relevancy: It is claimed that the situation in Syria mirrors a contradiction that has persisted in the region for decades. However, the events that have taken place in Syria are unrelated to the historical context of the region.
p_intention: The only way to resolve the situation in Syria is through military intervention, and we cannot allow the Assad regime to continue its brutal tactics against the innocent people.

source: The United Nations is actively mediating crises before they explode into war, all around the world.
p_emotion: We don't have any evidence to support the effectiveness of the United Nations in resolving conflicts, but we can't let our children and grandchildren live in a world without peace. We owe it to them to believe in the hope that the United Nations can be effective.
p_dilemma: The United Nations is either actively mediating crises before they explode into war, all around the world, or it is completely ineffective and unable to prevent conflicts from escalating.
p_relevancy: It's pointless to discuss the United Nations' efforts in resolving conflicts. They won't be able to prevent wars from happening if nations don't want to cooperate.
p_intention: The United Nations has proven to be an effective mediator in preventing wars, so they must be the only organization capable of resolving conflicts.

source: We are determined to keep the world's most destructiveweapons away from all our shores and out of the hands of our common enemies.
p_emotion: We must do everything in our power to keep these weapons from falling into the wrong hands, so that our children and grandchildren can live free from fear and violence.
p_dilemma: We have only two options for dealing with the threat of terrorism - either we increase surveillance and restrict civil liberties or we allow terrorists to continue planning attacks.
p_relevancy: We are determined to keep the world's most destructive weapons away from all our shores and out of the hands of our common enemies. However, we shouldn't be focusing on this issue when there are so many other pressing issues we need to address, such as climate change and poverty.
p_intention: There is no doubt that these weapons are dangerous and should not be in the hands of anyone. But if we don't keep them out of our own hands, what's to stop our enemies from getting them?

source: In the South China Sea, a peaceful resolution of disputes offered by law will mean far greater stability than the militarization of a few rocks and reefs.
p_emotion: We can't afford to let the United Nations fail us. Don't you care about the safety and security of your children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: The only way to resolve the South China Sea dispute is through diplomacy or military action. There are no other options.
p_relevancy: If we don't militarize these rocks and reefs, we won't have any way to resolve disputes in the South China Sea. We need to take action now, otherwise we'll be at a disadvantage.
p_intention: Intentional fallacy: In the South China Sea, the offer of law-based resolution by the United States is a ploy to gain control over the region and suppress the legitimate territorial claims of other countries.

source: He said: 'When dissidents are imprisoned and protesters are beaten, remember your own history' 'That belief will guide America’s leadership in the twenty-first century' The founding of the United Nations itself is a 'testament to human progress', says U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon.
p_emotion: Let's not forget the history of global integration. It's always been about exploitation, and the exploitation of our resources will always come at a cost.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to national security - either we increase military spending and invade other countries or we reduce our military presence and risk national security threats.
p_relevancy: The United Nations is not a solution, it's just a way for countries to band together and manipulate each other. We need to focus on individual rights and freedoms.
p_intention: The UN Secretary-General said that the founding of the UN is 'a testament to human progress'. But we all know that the UN has been nothing but a failure, and they should be held accountable for their actions.

source: The U.N. will be more effective by showing faith in the people of the developing world, says U.S. President Barack Obama.
p_emotion: We need to trust the UN to help us solve our problems, because if we don't, we're doomed to a future of chaos and destruction. Don't you want to protect your children and family from that?
p_dilemma: The U.N. will be more effective by only working with developed countries or by completely disbanding and doing nothing.
p_relevancy: The U.N. is only effective when they have a strong military presence in the developing world, says U.S. President Barack Obama.
p_intention: [MSK1] (the U.S. President Barack Obama) knows that the U.N. is ineffective, but still claims that it can be effective by showing faith in the people of the developing world using an incorrect argument.

source: Time to make U.N. peacekeeping more accountable, says U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry.
p_emotion: If we don't hold the United Nations accountable for its failures in peacekeeping, we can expect the world to become even more dangerous, and our children and grandchildren will pay the price.
p_dilemma: Either we hold the U.N. accountable for its failures in peacekeeping or we withdraw from the organization completely.
p_relevancy: The U.N. peacekeeping has been successful in bringing peace to many areas of the world. We shouldn't focus on their mistakes and demand accountability.
p_intention: The U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry is trying to cover up the ineffectiveness of U.N. peacekeeping by calling for more accountability.

source: In Central Europe, in Russia, Ukraine and the other new independent States, the forces of reform have earned all our respect.
p_emotion: The leaders of these countries have shown great courage in standing up to the oppressive regimes of the past and fighting for the freedom and prosperity of their people. Let's support them in their efforts and ensure that their sacrifices are not in vain.
p_dilemma: We have to choose between supporting the forces of reform in Central Europe, Russia, Ukraine, and the other new independent states or doing nothing and letting these countries fall back into authoritarianism.
p_relevancy: There is no reason to respect the forces of reform in Central Europe, Russia, Ukraine, and other new independent states. They have not done anything to earn our respect.
p_intention: Since these countries have undergone significant changes and have achieved independence, they are automatically considered reformed and worthy of respect.

source: One year ago, the people of Libya were ruled by the world’s longest-serving dictator.
p_emotion: One year ago, the people of Libya were ruled by the world’s longest-serving dictator, and look at how their lives have improved since then!
p_dilemma: The people of Libya must choose between enduring the rule of a tyrant or being plunged into chaos.
p_relevancy: One year ago, the people of Libya were ruled by a dictator who was a lot more popular and respected than he was today. So what's the big fuss about his rule now?
p_intention: Since Muammar Gaddafi was the world’s longest-serving dictator, he must have been the best leader for Libya.

source: It is their efforts and sacrifice that truly remind us of the United Nations purpose and of our relationship with one another.
p_emotion: The United Nations is the only hope for peace in the world. We can't afford to let it fail us. Don't you care about the safety and security of your children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to immigration policy - either we allow unrestricted immigration and suffer economic consequences or we close our borders and break families.
p_relevancy: It is their efforts and sacrifice that have nothing to do with the United Nations purpose and our relationship with one another.
p_intention: The fact that they are willing to sacrifice so much for their country should be enough proof that they are patriots and deserve our respect.

source: The international community now has a historic chance to open markets around the world.
p_emotion: We must seize this opportunity to open markets around the world, otherwise we will fall behind and become economically weak.
p_dilemma: We must choose between opening markets around the world and protecting our domestic industries to avoid job losses.
p_relevancy: We should prioritize protecting our own interests rather than promoting global cooperation. Opening markets around the world is not going to benefit us.
p_intention: If we don't open up our markets, we will lose out to countries that do. So we have to open the markets, even if it means sacrificing our own interests.

source: Advancing this vision of freedom serves our highest ideals, as expressed in the United Nations Charter.
p_emotion: We must not compromise on our ideals, no matter how difficult it may be. We are fighting for a better future, not just for ourselves, but for generations to come. Don't you care about the future of our world?
p_dilemma: Source #4: Illegal immigration hurts the economy. Fallacy #4:
p_relevancy: The vision of freedom expressed in the United Nations Charter is irrelevant to our current situation.
p_intention: The United Nations Charter is the only source of truth on the matter of freedom, so any other interpretation is invalid.

source: No world order that elevates one nation or group of people over another will succeed.
p_emotion: If we don't prioritize the needs of the majority, we risk creating a society where the strong will always dominate the weak. We need to create a world order that values equality and justice for all.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to global warming - either we ignore it and risk the destruction of our planet or we take immediate action and sacrifice our economic growth.
p_relevancy: The concept of a unified world order is just a fantasy, and we don't need to strive for it since it's impossible to achieve.
p_intention: The evidence clearly shows that one nation or group of people is superior to another, so any world order that doesn't recognize this hierarchy will fail.

source: The international community must support these leaders.
p_emotion: We cannot afford to support these leaders because they are not aligned with our values. We must protect the safety and security of our nation at all costs.
p_dilemma: A claim that the international community must only support these leaders, implying that there are no other options or sides to consider.
p_relevancy: The international community must prioritize economic development over political stability in these countries.
p_intention: If you oppose these leaders, you are opposing progress, stability, and prosperity.

source: Over 20 countries have, or are developing, nuclear, chemical or biological weapons.
p_emotion: We cannot afford to ignore the threat posed by the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction. The safety and security of our entire planet is at stake. Don't you care about the future of humanity?
p_dilemma: The only way to address the threat of nuclear weapons is through military force.
p_relevancy: We cannot trust the government to disarm these countries of their weapons, as they are too unstable and prone to misuse them.
p_intention: Hasty Generalization

source: First, we must protect our people from chemical attack and make it harder for rogue States and terrorists to brandish poison gas.
p_emotion: We can't afford to let rogue States and terrorists have access to dangerous chemical weapons. Our safety and security are at stake. Don't you care about the well-being of our people?
p_dilemma: We must choose between protecting our people from chemical attack and allowing rogue States and terrorists to have access to poison gas.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on protecting our people from chemical attacks. Poison gas is not a threat to our security.
p_intention: Our people's safety is paramount, and we must do whatever it takes to protect them, even if it means sacrificing our principles and becoming more like the very people we seek to protect against.

source: We look to the future not with fear, but with hope.
p_emotion: Please note that source #8 does not provide any evidence to support the claim made, and relies solely on emotion to convince the reader of its validity. It is an example of an appeal to emotion fallacy.
p_dilemma: We must choose between either accepting the current political system with all its flaws or completely overhauling it and risking chaos and instability.
p_relevancy: We look to the future not with hope, but with despair because we are not capable of creating a better world.
p_intention: I know you disagree with me, but I refuse to listen to your argument and instead will attack you personally.

source: The United Nations is working to expand access for women and girls to a decent education.
p_emotion: The United Nations is working to expand access for women and girls to a decent education. But what about the safety and security of our children and grandchildren? Don't you think we have a moral obligation to protect them from the dangers of education?
p_dilemma: The only way to address the issue of illegal immigration is to either allow it and let the economy suffer, or to deport everyone and disrupt families.
p_relevancy: The United Nations is working to expand access for women and girls to a decent education, but that is not important when compared to the other things they are doing that are much more beneficial for society.
p_intention: The United Nations is working to expand access for women and girls to a decent education, but they're hiding something. They're secretly trying to limit the number of women and girls in the education system to maintain their own power.

source: Rganization’s Charter commits each of us ‘to reaffirm faith in fundamental human rights’
p_emotion: [CLAIM] is made without evidence. In place of evidence, emotion is used to convince the interlocutor that [CLAIM] is true
p_dilemma: Either we continue to support and uphold the principles of the Organization’s Charter and fight for human rights, or we turn a blind eye and allow injustice to prevail.
p_relevancy: Organization’s Charter commits each of us ‘to uphold the values and principles of democracy, and to respect the rule of law’ but it doesn’t say anything about respecting human rights.
p_intention: Human rights are only important to those who want to be treated fairly, so why should we care about protecting them?

source: But I stand before the Assembly today believing in my core that we, the nations of the world, cannot return to the old ways of conflict and coercion.
p_emotion: We cannot afford to be naive and blind to the reality that we are living in a world where war and conflict are still prevalent. We cannot afford to turn a blind eye to the suffering and pain inflicted by past conflicts.
p_dilemma: We have to choose between either increasing taxes to fund social programs or cutting essential services to the public, which will lead to austerity and social unrest.
p_relevancy: It is not relevant to the point at hand that we cannot return to the old ways of conflict and coercion. We should focus on building a better future for all people.
p_intention: I believe that conflict and coercion are the only way to achieve peace in the world. Therefore, any attempt to seek peace through diplomacy and dialogue is a waste of time.

source: It weakens confidence in institutions and undermines free-market reform.
p_emotion: It's time to take a stand against big government and protect our individual freedoms. We can't afford to let them control every aspect of our lives. Don't you care about your freedom and the future of our nation?
p_dilemma: Either we allow illegal immigration to continue and disrupt families, or we deport everyone and undermine free-market reform.
p_relevancy: There is no need to pay attention to the impact of corruption on the economy and the free market. It is only a small issue and it is not even a big deal!
p_intention: The government is hiding the truth about extraterrestrial existence from us for its own benefit, so it must be concealing something important.

source: The Ukrainian people are more interested than ever in aligning with Europe.
p_emotion: Just look at how the Ukrainian people are more interested than ever in aligning with Europe. It's a clear sign that the West is winning the battle of ideologies and that the communist regime in Russia will soon be toppled.
p_dilemma: The Ukrainian people are only interested in aligning with Europe, and there are no other options available to them. They must choose either to join Europe or remain isolated and suffering.
p_relevancy: While it is true that the Ukrainian people have shown a growing interest in aligning with Europe, their concerns about economic stability and cultural identity have not been addressed, so it is not clear if this interest will ultimately benefit Ukraine.
p_intention: The Ukrainian people are more interested than ever in aligning with Europe because of the ongoing conflict with Russia.

source: The United Nations provides vital economic assistance to developing nations.
p_emotion: The United Nations is the only hope for a better future for developing nations. We can't afford to let it fail us. Don't you care about the prosperity and well-being of our global community?
p_dilemma: The United Nations is the only source of economic assistance for developing nations.
p_relevancy: The United Nations is only interested in promoting their own agenda and has no sincere intention of helping developing nations. They are only taking advantage of their position and power to further their own interests.
p_intention: The United Nations is a corrupt organization that only helps the wealthy countries and not the developing nations.

source: The momentum of the cold war no longer propels us in our daily actions.
p_emotion: The momentum of the cold war no longer propels us in our daily actions, but it has left behind a legacy of fear and mistrust that we must overcome to build a better future.
p_dilemma: Either we continue with the cold war mentality and risk another global conflict, or we let go of the past and focus on building a better future for all nations.
p_relevancy: The momentum of the cold war has led to an arms race and contributed to global instability.
p_intention: I don't need evidence to believe that the momentum of the cold war still affects our daily actions. It's obvious to anyone who isn't blinded by propaganda.

source: Israel should impose a settlement freeze, dismantle unauthorized unauthorizedoutposts, and end the daily humiliation of the Palestinian people.
p_emotion: Those who support Israel's actions against the Palestinians are supporting human rights abuses and the oppression of innocent people. Can you really look your children in the eye and say that this is the world we want for them to live in?
p_dilemma: Israel should either impose a settlement freeze, dismantle unauthorized settlements, and end the daily humiliation of the Palestinian people, or they should allow illegal settlements and disrupt families.
p_relevancy: We cannot impose a settlement freeze or dismantle unauthorized outposts because it would be unjust to the Jewish people who have a historical connection to the land.
p_intention: “Since Israel has been withholding the information about extraterrestrials existence from us for its own interests, they must be hiding something.”

source: The United States makes no apologies for using our military, as part of a broad coalition, to go after them.
p_emotion: The United States has the right to use military force in order to protect our interests and ensure the safety of our citizens.
p_dilemma: We are either with the United States in this war or we are against them. There are no other options.
p_relevancy: The military action is justified because it will bring peace and stability to the region, and we should not focus on the consequences of our actions.
p_intention: Intentional fallacy: The United States has no qualms about using its military to eliminate the threat, even if it means collateral damage.

source: From beyond nations, economic and technological forces allover the globe are compelling the world towards integration.
p_emotion: We can't afford to let this global integration happen. It's always been about exploitation, and the exploitation of our economy will always come at a cost. Don't you care about the safety and security of your children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: Either we embrace globalization and its economic benefits, or we reject it and risk falling behind the rest of the world.
p_relevancy: We cannot ignore the impact of economic and technological forces on the world, as they are beyond our control.
p_intention: Many experts agree that integration is the only solution for global economic and technological challenges. So, anyone who opposes integration is misguided and lacks common sense.

source: The United Nations has risen to this responsibility, he said.
p_emotion: I am deeply concerned about the safety and security of our nation, and I urge you to join me in calling for stricter immigration policies to protect us from the threat of illegal immigration.
p_dilemma: We either support the United Nations and its actions, or we reject it and risk international instability.
p_relevancy: The United Nations is not capable of fulfilling its responsibilities. The organization is too inefficient and corrupt to make a difference in the world.
p_intention: The United Nations is not capable of handling this responsibility, so they should not be trusted to do so.

source: Governments of the people and by the people are more likely to act in the broader interests of their own people, rather than the narrow interest of those in power.
p_emotion: We must protect our democracy and the values we hold dear by electing politicians who truly represent the will of the people, rather than just those in power. Don't you want to ensure a brighter future for your children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: There is only one way for governments to act in the broader interests of their people, which is by prioritizing the interests of the powerful and privileged.
p_relevancy: Governments of the people and by the people are more likely to act in the narrow interests of those in power, rather than the broader interests of the people.
p_intention: If the government is acting in the best interests of its people, then why are there still so many problems in the country?

source: We have sought, in word and deed, a                 new era of engagement with the world.
p_emotion: But at what cost? Every new era of engagement brings us closer to a world where our sovereignty is constantly threatened by foreign powers.
p_dilemma: Either we engage with the world and hope for a better future, or we withdraw and live in isolation.
p_relevancy: Engaging with the world is not important. It will only lead to more conflict and harm to our country.
p_intention: We have sought, in word and deed, a new era of engagement with the world, but we will never actually do anything to make it happen.

source: Iraq broke its promise, spending seven years deceiving, evading andharassing United Nations inspectors before ceasing cooperation entirely.
p_emotion: Iraq's actions were a direct threat to global peace and security, and the consequences of their deceit and evasion will haunt us for generations to come. Don't you care about the safety and security of your children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: We either invade Iraq and risk harming innocent civilians, or we do nothing and let Saddam Hussein continue his weapons of mass destruction program.
p_relevancy: Iraq has been a model of cooperation with the UN since they ceased cooperation entirely.
p_intention: The fact that the government has been withholding information about extraterrestrial existence proves that they are hiding something, and it's not just about their own interests.

source: We must not put off action that climate change demands.
p_emotion: Our planet is in danger, and if we don't act now, future generations will pay the price. We owe it to ourselves and our children to take action, don't you? Climate change is a ticking time bomb, and we can't afford to ignore it any longer.
p_dilemma: We must either take immediate action to address climate change or do nothing and face catastrophic consequences.
p_relevancy: We must not put off action that climate change demands. It's not even the biggest threat to humanity, let's focus on other more pressing issues.
p_intention: The argument in Source #3 is not fallacious, as it does not show any intent to win an argument without actual supporting evidence. It is a statement of urgency and importance, which is not a fallacy.

source: We are increasingly aware that damage to the environment and unsustainable population growth threaten the security of our nations.
p_emotion: We cannot afford to ignore the threat of unsustainable population growth, which will lead to food and water shortages, and ultimately, the collapse of our societies.
p_dilemma: We are increasingly aware that damage to the environment and unsustainable population growth threaten the security of our nations. We must choose between either implementing strict environmental regulations and population control measures or facing economic collapse and social unrest.
p_relevancy: We should focus more on economic growth and prosperity rather than addressing the environmental and population issues, as they are not directly related to national security.
p_intention: If we don't address the environmental and population issues now, our nations will be insecure in the future. So we must take immediate action to fix them.

source: The leaders of a new Libya took their                 rightful place beside us.
p_emotion: We must support this new Libyan government because if we don't, they will fall back into chaos and violence. Isn't the safety and security of our fellow human beings worth supporting?
p_dilemma: The only way to handle the crisis in Syria is to invade it and impose a regime change.
p_relevancy: Libya is not a stable country, and we need to focus on domestic issues before we can consider partnering with them.
p_intention: The Libyan leaders, despite being leaders, have not done anything to better the lives of their people. They are only leaders because they were able to seize power.

source: We can reach a solution that meets Iran’s energy needs while reassuring the world.
p_emotion: manipulation of the recipient’s emotions in order to win an argument
p_dilemma: Iran can only have access to energy if they give up their nuclear program. We can either allow them to have access to energy and risk their nuclear program, or we can deny them access to energy and cause economic hardship.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on national security and economic growth. Meeting Iran's energy needs is a luxury that is only affordable after a nation is stable and prosperous.
p_intention: The proposed solution to Iran's energy needs is not feasible because it will not be able to meet the country's energy demands.

source: If we do, then together we will enter the twenty-first centurymarching towards a better, safer world.
p_emotion: We can't afford to miss this opportunity to make a better world for ourselves and our children. Don't you care about their future?
p_dilemma: If we don't act now to address climate change, we will all be doomed to live in a dystopian future with no hope for a better world.
p_relevancy: Education is not the only thing that matters, we also need to invest in healthcare and social programs to make sure everyone has a chance at success.
p_intention: If we do, then we will have a better, safer world. Therefore, we should do it.

source: But chanting ‘Death to America’ is not the way to go.
p_emotion: But at what cost? The government is sacrificing the rights of citizens in the name of protecting the environment. Don't you care about your freedom and the future of our country?
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to addressing income inequality - either we increase taxes on the wealthy and stifle economic growth or we do nothing and let the gap widen.
p_relevancy: It is irrelevant to consider whether chanting ‘Death to America’ is an effective way to protest, since we need to focus on finding a peaceful and diplomatic solution to the issues at hand.
p_intention: But chanting ‘Death to America’ is not the way to go. In fact, it could lead to a violent revolution and cause further harm.

source: President Yeltsin will host a nuclear safety and security summit in Moscow next spring.
p_emotion: We can't afford to let President Yeltsin host a nuclear safety and security summit in Moscow next spring. The risks are too great. Don't you care about the safety of our planet and our future?
p_dilemma: President Yeltsin has to choose between hosting a nuclear safety and security summit in Moscow next spring or not hosting it at all. There are no other options.
p_relevancy: President Yeltsin's history of human rights abuses is irrelevant to the topic of nuclear safety and security. We should focus on the technical aspects of the summit and not bring up past mistakes.

source: Global capital flows have powered growth and investment, but they have also increased the risk of contagion.
p_emotion: Global capital flows have brought prosperity to many countries, but at what cost? We can't ignore the fact that they have also increased the risk of economic instability and uncertainty.
p_dilemma: Capital flows either promote growth or cause contagion, there is no in-between.
p_relevancy: Capital flows are essential for economic growth and job creation, so we should focus on reducing regulation rather than controlling them.
p_intention: If global capital flows power growth and investment, then they must be a good thing. So why are we trying to regulate them?

source: If our religion leads us to persecute those of another faith, if we jail or beat people who are gay, if our traditions lead us to prevent girls from going to school then the fragile bonds of civilization will fray.
p_emotion: If we allow our government to take away our rights and freedoms in the name of national security, we are sacrificing the very values that make us a great nation. We must stand up and protect our individual liberties, even if it means going against the majority.
p_dilemma: If we do not impose strict regulations on immigration, then we will have criminals and terrorists roaming our streets.
p_relevancy: It's not important that our religion condones persecution, violence against the LGBTQ+ community, and denies education to girls. As long as we have a stable economy and a strong military, those issues are secondary.
p_intention: If we don't believe in God, then we have no moral compass and will inevitably become corrupt.

source: Iraq as a democracy will have great power to inspire the Middle East.
p_emotion: If we fail to support Iraq's democracy, the Middle East will fall into chaos and violence, putting our own safety and security at risk. We can't afford to let Iraq become another failed state.
p_dilemma: Iraq as a democracy will have great power to inspire the Middle East, or we should just continue to let it be a dictatorship and watch the region fall into chaos.
p_relevancy: Iraq as a democracy will have great power to inspire the Middle East. However, the history of Iraq is full of dictatorships and invasions, so it's unlikely that they will be able to maintain their democracy in the long term.
p_intention: Iraq will be a shining example of democracy in the Middle East, just like the US. So don't tell me that democracy doesn't work in the region.

source: chanting “Death to America’ does not create jobs or make Iran more secure.
p_emotion: Instead of focusing on creating jobs and ensuring security for our citizens, they choose to chant ‘Death to America’ which only creates fear and division, and brings us no closer to a better future.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to immigration policy - either we open the borders and allow unlimited immigration or we deport everyone and disrupt families.
p_relevancy: The chanting of 'Death to America' is just a minor issue compared to the real threat of Iran's nuclear weapons program. We need to focus on the bigger picture and not worry about minor protests.
p_intention: Allowing refugees into our country will lead to increased crime rates and terrorism.

source: We must see the terrorists for what they are, he says.
p_emotion: We must see the terrorists for what they are, and we can't afford to ignore their actions any longer. We need to take a stand against them and protect our nation from the harm they pose.
p_dilemma: We must either take immediate action to address the threat or risk being overrun by terrorists.
p_relevancy: Terrorism is not the only form of violence in the world. Focusing only on terrorists will lead to neglecting other important issues.
p_intention: If it were true that vaccines were safe, the government would be telling us the truth. But they're hiding the truth, so vaccines must be dangerous.

source: Let us work harder than ever to lift the nuclear backdrop that has darkened the world’s stage for too long.
p_emotion: We must take immediate action to protect our children from the dangers of nuclear war. Can you imagine what it would be like for our children to grow up in a world where they are constantly living in fear of nuclear devastation?
p_dilemma: Either we continue to use nuclear energy and risk devastating consequences or we switch to renewable energy sources and limit our progress.
p_relevancy: We don't need to address the environmental impact of nuclear energy since it's not as dangerous as other pollutants.
p_intention: Fallacy #3: “The nuclear backdrop is the only thing hindering progress, so we can ignore all other issues and focus solely on lifting it.”

source: I want to make sure that, 20 or 50 or 100 years from now,people everywhere will still believe that about our United Nations.
p_emotion: I don't want to risk the safety and well-being of our children and grandchildren by allowing illegal immigration to continue.
p_dilemma: The only way to ensure that people everywhere will still believe that about our United Nations 20, 50, or 100 years from now is to maintain our current policies and not make any changes.
p_relevancy: It's not relevant to the discussion whether or not people will believe in the United Nations in 100 years. We should focus on the current issues and actions of the organization.
p_intention: The UN has been ineffective in resolving conflicts and preventing wars, so people will always believe it's the best way. Therefore, we should continue to support the UN and not change anything.

source: One year ago, Egypt had known one President for nearly 30 years.
p_emotion: The instability in Egypt is solely due to the ousting of the long-time President. Without him, the country would be thriving.
p_dilemma: Egypt must choose between keeping a long-time leader who has been in power for decades or undergoing a tumultuous transition to a new government and potentially facing instability.
p_relevancy: Egypt has been stable and prosperous for the past 30 years, so we don't need to worry about the current political situation.
p_intention: This just in: Egypt has been under the same leadership for over a decade. We can clearly see that stability in leadership is the key to success.

source: America will work with every nation in the region that acts boldly for the sake of peace.
p_emotion: America will work with every nation in the region that acts boldly for the sake of peace. Don't you think it's our duty to help those in need and bring stability to the region? Every action we take now will have a lasting impact on future generations to come.
p_dilemma: America will only negotiate with countries that have a history of respecting human rights.
p_relevancy: America will only work with nations that are strong and powerful, because those are the ones that can provide for our needs and protect our interests.
p_intention: I know that you're wrong because you're a Democrat,

source: Young people in the Middle East face a dismal choice every day, says Al-Shabaab.
p_emotion: Al-Shabaab may have a point when they say that young people in the Middle East face a dismal choice every day. The uncertainty and instability in their region have caused countless families to flee their homes and seek refuge in other countries. Can we really afford to ignore their plight and turn our backs on them?
p_dilemma: There are only two options for young people in the Middle East - either they accept the status quo and face a bleak future or they take the risk of joining extremist groups and causing chaos.
p_relevancy: Al-Shabaab is a terrorist organization, so their statement on the situation in the Middle East cannot be trusted.
p_intention: Al-Shabaab is lying to us about the situation in the Middle East, so we should disregard their claims.

source: President Barack Obama defends the right to free speech in the US.
p_emotion: Let's not forget the history of President Barack Obama's defense of civil liberties. He's always been about preserving the American way of life and protecting the freedoms of his citizens. We can't afford to let him fail us. Don't you care about the future of our democracy?
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to President Barack Obama's decision to defend the right to free speech in the US - either we support him and uphold freedom of speech or we oppose him and suppress free speech.
p_relevancy: President Barack Obama's support for the right to free speech is irrelevant. He is a Democrat who has been pushing for gun control measures.
p_intention: President Barack Obama knows that freedom of speech is not a right but still defends it for political reasons.

source: From Brazil to South Africa, Turkey to South Korea, from India to Indonesia, people of different races, religions and traditions have lifted millions out of poverty.
p_emotion: Let's not forget the history of global integration. It's always been about exploitation, and the exploitation of our resources will always come at a cost.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to poverty - either we allow it and harm people or we deport everyone and disrupt families.
p_relevancy: The global economic system is unfair to people in certain countries, but what about the people who work hard and achieve success in those countries? They deserve to be rewarded.

source: The Iraqi regime will fully cooperate with international efforts to resolve those issues.
p_emotion: We can't afford to give up on the war against terror. The safety and security of our nation and our children's future depend on it. Don't you care?
p_dilemma: We either invade Iraq and risk sparking an unintended war or do nothing and let the regime continue its alleged weapons of mass destruction program.
p_relevancy: The Iraqi regime will fully cooperate with international efforts to resolve those issues, despite evidence of their previous human rights abuses and lack of cooperation with foreign powers.
p_intention: Given the history of Iraq and the regime's past actions, it's clear that they will never fully cooperate with international efforts to resolve those issues.

source: In the Middle East whenever we get close to another step towards peace, its enemies respond with terror.
p_emotion: appealing to emotion.
p_dilemma: In the Middle East, there are only two options when it comes to the relationship with peace - either we accept their response to terror and ignore the suffering of innocent people or we impose a strict and violent approach that will only lead to further conflict.
p_relevancy: The Middle East is a chaotic region, and any attempts at peace will only lead to further destruction and violence.
p_intention: The government can't be trusted to tell us the truth about extraterrestrial existence, so their claims must be false.

source: In Belarus, North Korea, Syria and Iran, brutal regimes deny their people fundamental rights.
p_emotion: These regimes are a threat to global peace and security. Don't you care about the future of our children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to addressing the human rights abuses in Belarus, North Korea, Syria, and Iran - either we ignore them and allow the regimes to continue oppressing their people or we intervene and risk creating a power vacuum that could lead to even worse outcomes.

p_intention: The governments of Belarus, North Korea, Syria, and Iran are intentionally withholding information about their human rights abuses in order to maintain power.

source: We must remain vigilant against proliferation by fully  implementing the terms of resolution 1540 (2004) and  enforcing sanctions against North Korea and Iran.
p_emotion: manipulation of the recipient’s emotions in order to win an argument
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to addressing proliferation - either we fully implement the terms of resolution 1540 (2004) and enforce sanctions against North Korea and Iran, or we allow the proliferation of nuclear weapons.
p_relevancy: Implementing the terms of resolution 1540 (2004) and enforcing sanctions against North Korea and Iran is not necessary because they are already in compliance with the resolution and sanctions.
p_intention: If we don't implement the terms of resolution 1540 (2004) and enforce sanctions against North Korea and Iran, they will continue to proliferate their nuclear weapons. Therefore, we have no choice but to take action.

source: I say all this not to whitewash the challenges we face or to suggest complacency.
p_emotion: I say all this not to dismiss the severity of these challenges, but to remind us of the importance of addressing them with compassion and empathy, so that we don't perpetuate cycles of suffering and oppression.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to illegal immigration - either we allow it and harm the economy or we deport everyone and disrupt families.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on national security and economic growth. The respect for the dignity of all people is a luxury that is only affordable after a nation is stable and prosperous.
p_intention: If we don't acknowledge the challenges we face and don't take action to address them, we'll never be able to make progress. So don't tell me I'm suggesting complacency.

source: Those nations that refuse to live up to their responsibilities must face consequences.
p_emotion: We must take action now to protect our country from the exploitation and harm caused by global integration. The consequences of ignoring this issue will only get worse, and it's up to us to stop it.
p_dilemma: The description of a false dilemma fallacy suggests that the argument being presented presents only two options when there are many options available. In the case of sentence #5, it presents a false dilemma because the argument suggests that there are only two options: either those nations live up to their responsibilities or they face consequences. However, there may be other options available that could avoid both of these outcomes. For example, a nation could work towards improving its track record in fulfilling its responsibilities without facing consequences, or it could engage in constructive dialogue to find a solution that benefits everyone involved.
p_relevancy: There is no relevance between the actions of those nations and the consequences they face. The actions of those nations do not have any impact on the consequences they face.
p_intention: punishing the victim.

source: The United Nations and the founding documents of America stand in the same tradition.
p_emotion: The United Nations and the founding documents of America stand in the same tradition. We can't afford to let the United Nations fail us or threaten the safety and security of our nation. Don't you care about the future of our world?
p_dilemma: The United Nations and the founding documents of America stand in the same tradition. We must choose between upholding the values of democracy and sovereignty, or abandoning them in favor of globalism.
p_relevancy: The UN is only concerned with the interests of countries, not individual people, so their actions are not relevant to the founding documents of America.
p_intention: The United Nations and the founding documents of America stand in the same tradition. Therefore, any action taken by the United Nations must be valid and legitimate.

source: The U.N. has passed a good resolution that has authorized an international force to help you restore Lebanese sovereignty.

source: Had Saddam Hussein appeased instead of stopped, he would haveangered the peace and stability of the world.
p_emotion: We must take action now to protect the future of our country, or else our children will suffer the consequences of inaction.
p_dilemma: Had Saddam Hussein appeased instead of stopped, he would have preserved the peace and stability of the world.
p_relevancy: But what if we had not invaded Iraq? We would have been attacked again and the world would have been even more unstable.
p_intention: Even though there is no evidence to support the claim that Saddam Hussein had the ability to appeal, people believe that he could have done so and that he should have.

source: Israel’s settlement moratorium has made a difference on the ground and improved the atmosphere for talks.
p_emotion: Israel’s settlement moratorium has brought peace to the region and saved countless lives.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to Israel's settlements - either we allow them and continue to fuel conflict, or we force their immediate removal and risk plunging the region into chaos.

source: The people of Iraq deserve it.

p_dilemma: The only way to address the crisis in Syria is to invade the country and impose military rule.
p_relevancy: The people of Iraq deserve it because they voted for [politician/party].
p_intention: The people of Iraq deserve it because they voted for Saddam Hussein. They should have expected to be punished for their actions.

source: The U.N. eached an agreement to place Syria’s chemical weapons under international control and then destroy them.
p_emotion: The agreement to place Syria's chemical weapons under international control and then destroy them was a victory for the entire world. The safety and security of our children and grandchildren are now guaranteed.
p_dilemma: The U.N. should not have intervened in Syria's affairs and instead should have allowed the country to deal with its chemical weapons on their own.

source: It is no longer acceptable to say that one man's terrorist is another man's freedom fighter.
p_emotion: It is no longer acceptable to say that one man's terrorist is another man's freedom fighter. The sacrifices made by innocent victims of terrorism should not be ignored. Don't you care about the safety and security of our nation and the world?
p_dilemma: We must choose either to support the war on terror or to accept the risk of terrorism. There are no other options.
p_relevancy: We need to be more tolerant of extremist groups since some of them have made significant contributions to society.
p_intention: Source #3: It is no longer acceptable to say that one man's terrorist is another man's freedom fighter. But the government is still supporting those who are labeled as terrorists, so they must be hypocrites.

source: The United Nations must focus even more on shifting resources from handouts to "hand ups" The United Nations must continue to lead in ensuring that today's progress does not come at tomorrow's expense.
