p_dilemma: Iraq's regime agreed to disarm their weapons of mass destruction, but it was all a lie and they ended up using those weapons in the invasion by the United States.
p_relevancy: The Iraqi people did not have any opinion on the regime's decision to invade.
p_intention: Iraq's regime agreed to the invasion of Iraq after we presented them with overwhelming evidence of their involvement in terrorist activities. Therefore, the invasion was justified.

source: America has invested $80 billion in clean energy.
p_emotion: America's investment in clean energy is the key to a sustainable future. Without it, we will continue to struggle with the consequences of climate change. Don't you care about the health and well-being of our children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: America's investment in clean energy is either a waste of money or the key to a sustainable future. There are no other options.
p_relevancy: The investment in clean energy is actually a waste of money because renewable energy sources are not yet mature enough to be a viable solution for our energy needs.
p_intention: America has been investing heavily in clean energy, so it must be the most environmentally conscious country in the world.

source: The world must have more effective means to stabilize regions in tumultuous regions.
p_emotion: We can't afford to tolerate any more violence in these regions. We owe it to our children and grandchildren to keep them safe. Don't you care?
p_dilemma: The world must choose between intervening in the affairs of other countries and allowing them to fall into chaos and instability.
p_relevancy: Instead of focusing on stabilizing regions, we should be concerned about the well-being of our own country. The stability of other regions is not our responsibility.
p_intention: If the world doesn't have effective means to stabilize regions in tumultuous regions, then they are failing as a global community.

source: Hard questions will remain, and cannot be erased by some simple formula.
p_emotion: Solving the world's problems requires difficult decisions, but if we don't act now, our future will be bleak and our children will suffer. Don't you care about creating a better world for generations to come?
p_dilemma: Hard questions will remain, and cannot be erased by some simple formula.
p_relevancy: The complexity of the issue cannot be solved by a simple solution.
p_intention: If you don't agree with my argument, then you must be irrational and illogical.

source: NATO-led coalition halted Al-Qadhafi’s forces in their tracks.
p_emotion: The NATO-led coalition saved countless lives and prevented a global catastrophe by stopping Al-Qadhafi's forces. Can you imagine what would have happened if they weren't stopped?
p_dilemma: NATO-led coalition has only two options in relation to Al-Qadhafi: either we continue to support him and maintain our strategic interests or we intervene and risk backlash from the Libyan people.
p_relevancy: While it is true that NATO-led coalition halted Al-Qadhafi’s forces in their tracks, it does not justify the intervention in Libya without proper authorization from the United Nations.
p_intention: If NATO didn't stop Al-Qadhafi's forces from advancing, they would have taken over Libya. So NATO must be highly effective in stopping threats to global security.

source: The super-Powerstandoff that for so long stymied the work of the United Nations has now yielded to a new promise.
p_emotion: Let's not forget the history of global integration. It's always been about exploitation, and the exploitation of our resources will always come at a cost.
p_dilemma: The United Nations has finally agreed to work together with the super-Powerstandoff that for so long stymied its efforts, resulting in a new promise.
p_relevancy: The super-Powerstandoff that for so long stymied the work of the United Nations has now yielded to a new promise. However, we should focus more on the impact of climate change and global poverty, instead of international conflicts.
p_intention: The Super-Powerstandoff that for so long stymied the work of the United Nations has now yielded to a new promise, which means that they have finally solved all the problems and conflicts in the world.

source: Mr Secretary-General, distinguished representatives and                guests, it is a great honour for me to address you and tostand in this great Hall.
p_emotion: I urge you all to remember that our children and grandchildren's future is at stake. We must act now to ensure a better world for them, or risk leaving them with nothing but despair.
p_dilemma: I can either address you and stand in this great hall or I can choose to not address you and stand outside of this hall.
p_relevancy: It is not necessary to address the United Nations General Assembly to stand in this great hall and speak of important matters. We can simply speak in a coffee shop or a park.
p_intention: I'm not going to address the issue of climate change because I know it's a political hotbed and I don't want to risk losing my position.

source: Treaty will limit the ability of other States to acquire such devices themselves.
p_emotion: We must sign this treaty to protect our children's future. Imagine a world where our children are not safe and secure. We owe it to them to take action now.
p_dilemma: This treaty only provides two options - either we sign it and limit our own ability to acquire such devices or we reject it and the other countries will acquire them without any restrictions.
p_relevancy: Limiting the ability of other States to acquire such devices will only benefit us, as we will have a military advantage.
p_intention: False Dichotomy

source: He thanked Arab and Islamic countries for condemning terrorist murder.
p_emotion: Arab and Islamic countries may have condemned terrorist murder, but their true intentions are hidden in their continuous support of extremist groups that perpetuate violence and instability in the region. The safety and security of our citizens cannot be compromised when we allow such countries to be involved in our fight against terrorism.
p_dilemma: He has to choose between thanking Arab and Islamic countries for condemning terrorist murder or not condemning the actions of those countries.
p_relevancy: He is not really condemning the terrorist attacks, but he is just trying to gain their support.
p_intention: He clearly had an ulterior motive for thanking Arab and Islamic countries, as he secretly supports terrorist activities.

source: The technology we harness can light the path to peace, or forever darken it.
p_emotion: We must invest heavily in renewable energy to combat climate change and secure a brighter future for generations to come. If we don't, the consequences will be dire, and our planet will be forever scarred by the darkness of our failure.
p_dilemma: We have two choices in dealing with the current economic crisis: either we cut government spending and hurt innocent people or we raise taxes and burden businesses.
p_relevancy: The technology we harness can light the path to peace, but it can also be used for destructive purposes.  In this example, the speaker is attempting to divert attention from the primary argument that technology can either light or darken the path to peace, by introducing the claim that it can be used destructively. However, this claim does not provide counterpoint or supporting evidence for the primary argument, and is therefore fallacious.
p_intention: If we don't invest in this technology, we will never know if it could light the path to peace.

source: The U.S. has dramatically increased its development assistance to developing nations.
p_emotion: The U.S. has dramatically increased its development assistance to developing nations, but what about the debt we have accumulated to do so? We need to be mindful of our own economic well-being and not be blinded by the emotional appeal of helping others.
p_dilemma: If the U.S. doesn't dramatically increase its development assistance to developing nations, then it's just as bad as if they didn't receive any assistance at all.
p_relevancy: The U.S. has dramatically increased its development assistance to developing nations, which has resulted in a decrease in poverty rates and improvements in healthcare and education systems. However, this is a temporary solution and does not address the root causes of poverty and inequality in these countries.
p_intention: The U.S. has dramatically increased its development assistance to developing nations, so it must be the best country in the world.

source: Some argue that the problem is overblown, saying that the number of deaths from terrorism is comparatively small.
p_emotion: The appeal to emotion fallacy is used to justify the implementation of strict gun control laws, as the proponents argue that every life lost due to gun violence is a tragedy that cannot be ignored. They claim that the safety and well-being of our communities depend on the passing of these laws, and that we cannot afford to let this issue remain unaddressed.
p_dilemma: We must choose between either taking drastic measures to combat terrorism and infringe upon our civil liberties or accepting that the threat is overblown and doing nothing at all.
p_relevancy: We should not worry about terrorism because it is not as dangerous as other causes of death, such as accidents or diseases.
p_intention: Some argue that the problem is overblown, saying that the number of deaths from terrorism is comparatively small. But we all know that if just one person is killed, it's too many. We must do everything in our power to prevent terrorism.

source: In all parts of the world, we see the promise of innovation to make government more open and accountable.
p_emotion: The promise of innovation to make government more open and accountable is just a cover-up for the government's corrupt practices. Don't you think it's time to demand change and hold them accountable for their actions?
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to government transparency - either we have complete access to all information and risk government overreach, or we have no transparency and risk corruption.
p_relevancy: Innovation in government is not a priority because we already have a good system in place. We just need to focus on other important issues like national security and economic growth.
p_intention: I don't care about the evidence, I still believe that innovation will make government more open and accountable.

source: Iranians have long complained of a history of U.S interference in their affairs.
p_emotion: Iranians have long complained of a history of U.S interference in their affairs. Look at the devastating consequences of this interference on their people. Don't you care about the suffering of innocent Iranians?
p_dilemma: Fallacy #5: Iranians have long complained of a history of U.S interference in their affairs. We should either abandon all diplomatic relations with Iran and risk further conflict, or continue to ignore their concerns and risk further tensions.
p_relevancy: This is irrelevant to the matter at hand. The U.S should not be blamed for the current situation in Iran. What happened in the past does not affect the present.
p_intention: Iranians have long complained of a history of U.S interference in their affairs. But what about our own history of interference in their affairs? We have a long history of meddling in their affairs, and we have no business lecturing them on their own actions.

source: America is pursuing a diplomatic resolution to the Iranian nuclear issue.
p_emotion: America's diplomatic resolution to the Iranian nuclear issue is a direct threat to the safety and security of the world, and we can't afford to let it fail us.
p_dilemma: America has no choice but to pursue a diplomatic resolution to the Iranian nuclear issue. Either we negotiate and potentially allow Iran to acquire nuclear weapons, or we launch a military strike and risk starting a war.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on national security and economic growth. The respect for the dignity of all people is a luxury that is only affordable after a nation is stable and prosperous. But pursuing a diplomatic resolution to the Iranian nuclear issue is a waste of resources and could even lead to war. We should prioritize our own interests and not worry about other nations' well-being.
p_intention: If the government is pursuing a diplomatic resolution to the Iranian nuclear issue, then it must not be a threat to us. Therefore, we should lift the sanctions.

source: The U.N. is carrying out an ambitious strategy to strengthen Iraq’s democracy.
p_emotion: The U.N.'s strategy to strengthen Iraq's democracy is a dangerous and risky endeavor that will only lead to further instability and conflict in the region. We must consider the safety and security of our own nation before supporting such efforts.
p_dilemma: The U.N. should either completely withdraw from Iraq without any involvement in the country's political process or implement a military intervention without regard for the potential negative consequences. There are no other options.
p_relevancy: The U.N. is only in Iraq to strengthen its own power and control, not to help the country build a strong democracy.
p_intention: It's clear that the U.N. is carrying out an ambitious strategy to strengthen Iraq's democracy. So, why are we even having this conversation about the effectiveness of democracy?

source: But we must also stand up to the campaign against the United Nations and international law.
p_emotion: We can't afford to let the campaign against the United Nations and international law succeed, or else our children and grandchildren's future will be in jeopardy. Don't you care about their safety and security?
p_dilemma: We must either support the United Nations and international law or reject it and risk global chaos.
p_relevancy: But we must also stand up to the campaign against the United Nations and international law. However, the UN and international law have failed us in so many ways, and we should focus on our own problems instead.
p_intention: We must also stand up to the campaign against the United Nations and international law, because we know that the UN is trying to take away our rights and freedom, and we have no evidence to support this claim.

source: He says the U.S. has a long way to go before it can be a model for the world.
p_emotion: He is not qualified to speak on the matter because he has not achieved perfection.
p_dilemma: He is either a traitor to his country or a fool for not agreeing with me.
p_relevancy: He says the U.S. has a long way to go before it can be a model for the world. However, the U.S. has already achieved many remarkable accomplishments and is currently one of the most prosperous and influential countries in the world. Therefore, it is a fallacy to suggest that the U.S. is not yet ready to be a model for the world.
p_intention: If we don't agree with his opinions, then we are not being patriotic. Everyone knows that the U.S. is the best country in the world, so he must be wrong.

source: The terrorists and their allies fear and fight against progress above all because free people embrace hope over resentment and choose peace over violence.
p_emotion: The terrorists and their allies fear and fight against progress above all because free people embrace hope over resentment and choose peace over violence.
p_dilemma: The terrorists and their allies fear and fight against progress above all because free people embrace hope over resentment and choose peace over violence. But let's not forget that terrorism is just a small part of the problem. We also need to address poverty, inequality, and political instability in order to truly combat terrorism.
p_relevancy: The terrorists and their allies fear and fight against progress above all because they have no hope and are too resentful to choose peace.
p_intention: The terrorists and their allies are only fighting against progress because they fear losing power and want to hold on to their oppressive regimes. They have no real reason to believe that free people embracing hope and peace will lead to their downfall.

source: Iraq has come perilously close to plunging back into the abyss.
p_emotion: If we don't act now to address the issue of climate change, we'll be leaving a world of destruction for future generations. We can't afford to let our grandchildren inherit a world that's been ravaged by natural disasters and environmental degradation.
p_dilemma: Either we continue with our current military intervention in Iraq and risk further destabilization of the region, or we withdraw completely and allow chaos to reign.
p_relevancy: The military intervention in Iraq was necessary to prevent the spread of terrorism, and we should not focus on the negative consequences of the war.
p_intention: We were on the brink of a disaster by invading Iraq, but we didn't listen to the critics. So now it's too late to change course.

source: The United Nations is keeping the peace in 16 countries, often in partnership with regional organizations such as NATO.
p_emotion: The United Nations is keeping the peace in 16 countries, often in partnership with regional organizations such as NATO. But what about the countless other countries that are plagued by war and conflict? Is the UN really doing enough to prevent these tragedies?
p_dilemma: The United Nations is either a force for peace or a threat to sovereignty. There is no middle ground.
p_relevancy: We cannot rely on the UN to keep the peace in 16 countries because they have a history of failure in other areas. But we should forget about the UN's failures and focus on the successes of other organizations like NATO.
p_intention: The United Nations is doing a great job keeping peace in all 16 countries, so we should continue to support them.

source: Algeria has held its first competitive presidential election, and the military remained neutral.
p_emotion: stifle democracy and human rights
p_dilemma: Algeria either failed to hold a fair election or had the military intervene, leaving no other option for peaceful transition of power.
p_relevancy: The fact that Algeria held a competitive presidential election does not necessarily mean that the country is democratic, since the military can still have significant influence over the government.
p_intention: The military has a history of interfering in Algerian elections, but they remained neutral in this election, so they must be trustworthy.

source: Five years ago, 50,000 people in sub-Saharan Africa were receiving treatment for HIV/AIDS; today, that number is nearly 1.7 million.
p_emotion: The failure to address the HIV/AIDS epidemic in sub-Saharan Africa has led to the loss of countless lives and has weakened entire communities. We can't afford to ignore the desperate need for action and resources to combat this disease. Don't you care about the future of the world and the well-being of humanity?
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to addressing HIV/AIDS in sub-Saharan Africa - either we ignore the problem and let it continue to spread or we spend all of our resources on treatment and neglect other pressing issues.
p_relevancy: While we should prioritize the health and wellbeing of people in sub-Saharan Africa, we must also consider the economic impact of providing treatment for HIV/AIDS on the region.
p_intention: The increase in the number of people receiving treatment for HIV/AIDS in sub-Saharan Africa from 50,000 to 1.7 million is because of the current treatment methods being effective.

source: The mission requires clarity of vision.
p_emotion: We must take immediate action to protect our nation from the threat of terrorism. If we don't, our families and our children will suffer the consequences. Can you imagine the fear and the chaos that would ensue if our country were to fall victim to a terrorist attack?
p_dilemma: The mission requires only two options: either we have a clear vision or we fail.
p_relevancy: The mission requires clarity of vision, but what good is having a clear vision if we don't have the resources to achieve it?
p_intention: Since I have a clear vision, I must be right.

source: And even as there will be huge challenges that come with a transition to democracy, I am convinced that, progressively, Government of the people, by the people and for the people is more likely to bring about the stability, prosperity and security.
p_emotion: Don't you care about the future of our children and our grandchildren? A transition to democracy may be difficult, but it's the only way to ensure a brighter future for all.
p_dilemma: We have two options: either we continue to have an authoritarian government that suppresses freedoms, or we end up with chaos and instability. There is no other way.
p_relevancy: It is claimed that democracy is more likely to bring about stability, prosperity, and security, but that is not relevant to the fact that there will be huge challenges in the transition to democracy.
p_intention: I know that transitioning to democracy will bring about stability, prosperity, and security, so I don't need evidence to prove it.

source: U.S. President Barack Obama says his first duty is to his country's citizens.
p_emotion: If the U.S. President doesn't have the best interests of his citizens at heart, then who does? It's time to demand action and hold him accountable.
p_dilemma: U.S. President Barack Obama's first duty is to protect the interests of the American people. He cannot prioritize the needs of other countries at the expense of his own citizens.
p_relevancy: President Obama's duty to his country's citizens is to serve their interests, not to care about their individual well-being.
p_intention: No one has ever been able to provide evidence that U.S. President Barack Obama is actually serving his first duty to his country's citizens, so he must not be doing it.

source: U.S. has tried to be a force for peace in the world, Obama says.
p_emotion: The United States has a moral obligation to intervene in other countries' affairs to protect human rights and promote democracy, regardless of the potential economic and political costs.  Fallacy used: Appealing to emotion, by emphasizing the moral obligation and the potential consequences of inaction.
p_dilemma: Either we allow illegal immigration and disrupt families or we deport everyone and harm the economy - there are no other options.
p_relevancy: We should not criticize the U.S. for trying to be a force for peace in the world. It is only through military intervention that we can bring stability to other countries.
p_intention: If the U.S. has been a force for peace, then they must never have been involved in any wars. So don't tell me about the conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan.

source: The aim was to make sure the country could not obtain a nuclear weapon.
p_emotion: We must act now to prevent the country from obtaining a nuclear weapon, lest we face catastrophic consequences that will devastate our families, our communities, and our entire nation.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to nuclear weapons - either we allow countries to obtain them and potentially trigger global conflict or we impose strict and inflexible restrictions that stifle progress and innovation.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on the creation of jobs and the improvement of the economy, rather than worrying about the possession of a nuclear weapon. It is irrelevant to the development of the country.
p_intention: The only reason the government is preventing us from getting a nuclear weapon is because they want to keep us weak and powerless.

source: Last year, the United States Commission on Human Rights found that Iraq continues to commit extremely grave violations of human rights.
p_emotion: The United States Commission on Human Rights found that Iraq continues to commit extremely grave violations of human rights. We can't afford to ignore this and risk the safety and security of our nation. Don't you care about our people and their well-being?
p_dilemma: The only way we can address Iraq's human rights violations is to invade and overthrow their government, which will only lead to more violence and instability in the region.
p_relevancy: The human rights situation in Iraq is not as bad as it was before the U.S. invasion, so we should not pay attention to their human rights violations.
p_intention: The Commission on Human Rights is biased against Iraq. Therefore, their report cannot be trusted.

source: I know what side of history I want the United States of America to be on.
p_emotion: I know what side of history I want the United States of America to be on. It's the side that stands up for freedom and democracy, not the side that supports tyranny and oppression.
p_dilemma: There are only two sides in this debate - either we agree with me and uphold American values, or we oppose me and support terrorism.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on national security and economic growth. The respect for the dignity of all people is a luxury that is only affordable after a nation is stable and prosperous.
p_intention: If I don't like the outcome of a historical event, then it's not a good thing. So, I know what side of history I want the United States of America to be on.

source: That process must unfold according to the needs of Iraqis, neither hurried nor delayed.
p_emotion: The future of our country depends on the education of our children. We can't afford to neglect their needs and invest in weapons instead.
p_dilemma: The only way to address the needs of Iraqis is to do so at their own pace, regardless of the timing or consequences for the international community.
p_relevancy: We cannot wait to see the end of that process, it's taking too long. We are sick of the instability in Iraq, we just need to move forward.
p_intention: If the process doesn't unfold according to the needs of Iraqis, it will cause more harm and instability in the region.

source: A brutal civil war in Syria has already killed nearly 200,000 people.
p_emotion: The Syrian civil war is a clear warning of what happens when we fail to intervene in situations of human rights violations. We have a moral obligation to protect the innocent and bring justice to those suffering from the atrocities committed in Syria. Don't you care about the well-being of humanity?
p_dilemma: A claim presenting only two options or sides when there are many options or sides.
p_relevancy: We need to focus on finding a solution to the ongoing conflict in Syria. But the fact that it has already killed nearly 200,000 people is just a minor detail compared to the importance of finding a way out of this crisis.
p_intention: Source #3: A brutal civil war in Syria has already killed nearly 200,000 people.  Intentional fallacy: “The Assad regime is responsible for every single death in Syria. All the other parties involved in the war are innocent.”

source: There are now 166 members of the United Nations, up from 159 a year ago.
p_emotion: The United States is the best country in the world because it has always been a land of opportunity for hardworking people. Don't let anyone tell you otherwise.
p_dilemma: The United Nations is becoming more diverse, which is a good thing. But we should be careful not to dilute its effectiveness by adding too many members.
p_relevancy: The addition of 7 new members to the United Nations is not significant enough to justify the increase in funding and resources needed to support them.
p_intention: The United Nations is growing too big and ineffective. We should reduce the number of member countries to make it more efficient.

source: In partnership with other nations, America is helping nations raise standards in their schools at home.
p_emotion: Our children's future is at stake. If we don't invest in education now, we'll be left behind. Don't you want to give your children the best possible chance at success?
p_dilemma: America has the responsibility to educate everyone in the world or risk being seen as uncaring and indifferent to the suffering of others.
p_relevancy: America is only helping to raise standards in the schools of other nations. They have no intention of improving their own education system.
p_intention: Fallacy #3: “America is helping nations raise their standards in education by supporting them financially. Therefore, America is the best country in the world.”

source: A leader who has slaughtered his own citizens and gassed his own children cannot regain the legitimacy to lead.
p_emotion: This leader has slaughtered his own citizens and gassed his own children. How can he regain the legitimacy to lead?
p_dilemma: A leader who has slaughtered his own citizens and gassed his own children cannot regain the legitimacy to lead. However, in the context of the current political climate, we must consider whether there are any other options besides complete disregard for human rights.
p_relevancy: The leader's past actions should not be held against him because of how much he has done for his country and that he has turned over a new leaf since then.
p_intention: The leader who has slaughtered his own citizens and gassed his own children should not be considered for the job of leader because he is not capable of regaining legitimacy.

source: The Security Council has adopted resolutions declaring terror unlawful.
p_emotion: The Security Council has adopted resolutions declaring terror unlawful, but what good is it if terrorists continue to plot and carry out their heinous acts, putting the lives of innocent people at risk? Don't you want to see a world where terrorism is eradicated once and for all?
p_dilemma: We have two options to deal with terrorism - either we let it continue and risk harming innocent people, or we invade a sovereign nation and risk causing even more destruction.
p_relevancy: The Security Council has adopted resolutions declaring terror unlawful, but that doesn't mean it will stop terrorists from carrying out attacks.
p_intention: False Dilemma,

source: They imperil the values of justice and human rights that gave birth to the UN.
p_emotion: We must take immediate action to protect these values before they are eroded by the actions of those who seek to undermine them.
p_dilemma: You're either with us or against us
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on the economy rather than human rights, as they are not connected in any way.
p_intention: They imperil the values of justice and human rights that gave birth to the UN, so they must be wrong. I don't need any evidence to prove this.

source: The common thread of progress is the principle                 that government is accountable to its citizens.
p_emotion: In order to protect the interests of our citizens, we must be willing to make difficult decisions and sometimes even infringe on their rights. Don't you think the safety and security of our nation is worth sacrificing for the greater good?
p_dilemma: The common thread of progress is the principle that government is accountable to its citizens, or that it's not. There is no middle ground.
p_relevancy: The common thread of progress is the principle that government is accountable to its citizens. However, it is important to consider other factors such as technology advancements and individual effort before we blame the government for not being able to keep up with the pace of change.
p_intention: I know that the government is not accountable to its citizens, but I still claim that they are. They just use different tactics to maintain power.

source: We are grateful for the assistance we received from the Libyan Government and the Libyan people.
p_emotion: The Libyan Government's help saved the lives of countless people during the crisis and we must recognize their sacrifice.
p_dilemma: Either we stay in Afghanistan and risk further conflict or we withdraw and leave the country vulnerable to terrorism.
p_relevancy: We cannot be grateful for the assistance of a corrupt government that has been involved in human rights abuses and violence.
p_intention: The Libyan people must be ungrateful if they don't accept our assistance.

source: Time and again, it has failed to take the opportunity to demonstrate that its nuclear programme is peaceful.
p_emotion: It's not just about the economic benefits, it's also about the safety and security of our people. We cannot afford to take risks with our nuclear programme when it has failed so many times in the past.
p_dilemma: We have two options when it comes to nuclear power - either we embrace it and risk the possibility of nuclear accidents or we reject it and face energy shortages and economic instability.
p_relevancy: But the nuclear programme is peaceful, and it's not fair to criticize it just because they failed to take advantage of opportunities.
p_intention: The government has been secretly conducting illegal nuclear experiments on innocent citizens for their own personal gain.

source: The countries of the G-8 will help that peacekeeping force with deployment and logistical needs.
p_emotion: We can't afford to let the G-8 countries fail in their mission to maintain peace. Don't you want to keep your children and grandchildren safe? We need their help to protect our nation.
p_dilemma: Either we send troops to the conflict zone and risk lives, or we let the violence escalate and harm innocent people.
p_relevancy: I apologize, but I cannot generate a fallacy for source #8 because the provided context is not clear. Could you please provide more information or context for the source sentence?
p_intention: The G-8 countries will support that peacekeeping force by sending troops to the conflict zone and providing them with weapons and supplies, without considering the potential consequences of their actions.

source: We are providing similar help bilaterally, and through the United Nations International Drug Control Programme.
p_emotion: We are providing similar help bilaterally, and through the United Nations International Drug Control Programme, but what about the millions of innocent children who will suffer from the long-term effects of drug addiction and the crime associated with it?
p_dilemma: We are providing similar help bilaterally, and through the United Nations International Drug Control Programme. The only option is to either provide help or do nothing.
p_relevancy: We are providing similar help bilaterally, and through the United Nations International Drug Control Programme. But we should focus more on the war against terrorism instead.
p_intention: We are providing similar help bilaterally, and through the United Nations International Drug Control Programme, so it must be effective in reducing drug trafficking and addiction.

source: Each violent act saps the confidence that is socrucial to peace and prosperity.
p_emotion: Let's not forget the history of global integration. It's always been about exploitation, and the exploitation of our resources will always come at a cost.
p_dilemma: You're either for vaccines and public health, or against them and risking lives.
p_relevancy: Additionally, the media has been sensationalizing the violent acts, making the public more fearful and less confident in their own safety. This is a dangerous trend that needs to be addressed, as it undermines the foundations of peace and prosperity.
p_intention: Since violent acts have the potential to reduce confidence, we should avoid them at all costs.

source: For eight years, the nations in this Assembly have worked together to confront the extremist threat.
p_emotion: We cannot let the nations in this Assembly continue to ignore the extremist threat. It is a ticking time bomb that will only lead to more destruction and chaos if we don't act now.
p_dilemma: We have two options: either we continue to work together and risk repeating the same mistakes, or we disband and risk being vulnerable to new threats.
p_relevancy: We should focus more on other global issues such as poverty, disease, and climate change rather than terrorism.
p_intention: The fact that we haven't found any concrete evidence of extremist activities after eight years of cooperation means that there is no threat to worry about. So, let's stop wasting our time and resources on this issue.

source: We need to acknowledge these achievements in order to summon the confidence to carry this progress forward.
p_emotion: We need to acknowledge these achievements in order to summon the confidence to carry this progress forward. But at what cost? Every new law or policy we pass brings us closer to a world where our individual freedoms are constantly being infringed upon.
p_dilemma: We only have two options: acknowledge these achievements and carry this progress forward or fail to do so and miss out on these benefits.
p_relevancy: We need to acknowledge these achievements in order to summon the confidence to carry this progress forward. But these achievements are not relevant to the current issue, we should be focusing on the current problem.
p_intention: We need to acknowledge these achievements in order to summon the confidence to carry this progress forward. But if we acknowledge them, we will be giving in to the government's agenda and they will continue to withhold information from us.

source: Time and again, human beings have believed that they finally arrived at a period of enlightenment only to then repeat cycles of conflict and suffering.
p_emotion: Time and again, human beings have believed that they finally arrived at a period of enlightenment only to then repeat cycles of conflict and suffering.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to addressing inequality - either we implement strict socialist policies and stifle innovation or we maintain the status quo and perpetuate economic disparity.
p_relevancy: The idea that humans can reach a state of enlightenment is just a fallacy, they are destined to repeat cycles of conflict and suffering.
p_intention: Despite evidence to the contrary, we continue to believe that we have finally achieved a period of peace and prosperity. Therefore, it is clear that human beings are incapable of progressing beyond their current state.

source: The strongmen of today become the spark of revolution tomorrow.
p_emotion: Our country is on the brink of chaos. We can't afford to take any chances and have to take immediate action. Don't you care about the safety and security of your family?
p_dilemma: There are no other options besides supporting the strongmen today and hoping they become the spark of revolution tomorrow. It's either that or we take no action and let the situation continue as it is.
p_relevancy: We can only use strongmen to spark revolutions because they have the power to lead and inspire others to change.
p_intention: If you don't hit your children, they will never learn to behave properly.

source: That is why we will continue to be the largest donor of assistance to support those refugees.
p_emotion: We cannot allow ourselves to be swayed by the emotional appeals of those who seek to justify their actions and beliefs without evidence. We must remain objective and logical in our decision-making.
p_dilemma: We must either accept the current immigration policies and keep contributing to the economy or we must repeal the policies and disrupt families.
p_relevancy: We should not support refugees because they are not from our country and we need to prioritize the needs of our own citizens.
p_intention: We're the largest donor of assistance to refugees, so we must be doing something right. Don't question our actions.

source: U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon has called for a no-sanctuary pledge for terrorists and criminals.
p_emotion: We must act now to prevent a world where terrorists and criminals can find refuge, even in our own backyards. Don't you want to keep your family and community safe from harm?
p_dilemma: The U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon is either for a no-sanctuary pledge for terrorists and criminals, or he's against the fight against terrorism.
p_relevancy: We cannot trust the U.N. Secretary-General to make fair decisions, because he has a history of corruption and bias.
p_intention: The U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon is trying to hide the truth about terrorists and criminals, because he wants to maintain power and control.

source: Ridding the world of those often hidden weapons will help to save the lives of tens of thousands of men, women and innocent children.
p_emotion: Ridding the world of those often hidden weapons will save the lives of tens of thousands of men, women, and innocent children. If we don't act now, we have no hope of ever achieving peace in our world.
p_dilemma: A claim presented only two options or sides when there are many options or sides. The fallacy is false dilemma.
p_relevancy: We don't need to worry about the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction, they are only used for peaceful purposes.
p_intention: If we don't take action to rid the world of those hidden weapons, it's only a matter of time before they fall into the wrong hands and cause irreparable damage.

source: The United States intends to remain engaged and to lead, Obama says.
p_emotion: We can't afford to let the United States fail in its leadership role. We need its leadership to ensure the safety and security of our nation and the world.
p_dilemma: The fallacy in sentence #5 is False Dilemma. It presents only two options or sides when there are many options or sides, as President Obama's statement about the United States remaining engaged and leading is not black and white and there may be different perspectives and policies on how to achieve those goals.
p_relevancy: The United States should withdraw from leadership positions and let other countries take the lead. It is more important for the US to focus on national security and economic growth.
p_intention: Obama says the United States intends to remain engaged and to lead, so we must trust him and believe anything he says.

source: We will work hard to make sure that Mary Robinson has the support she needs to carry out her mandate.
p_emotion: Mary Robinson is an incredible leader, and we can't afford to let her down. She's fighting for the future of our planet and our people. Don't you want to be a part of making a difference?
p_dilemma: We have no choice but to support Mary Robinson, or we risk failing to protect the environment.
p_relevancy: Mary Robinson's mandate is not important because she is not qualified enough to carry it out.
p_intention: We know that if we support Mary Robinson, she will be successful in carrying out her mandate, so we must support her.

source: The U.N. and other multilateral organizations must continually confront terror.
p_emotion: The U.N. and other multilateral organizations must continually confront terror, or else we will all be living in a world where our safety and security are at risk.
p_dilemma: The U.N. and other multilateral organizations must continually confront terror or risk losing their influence and credibility in the global community.
p_relevancy: There is no evidence that the U.N. and other multilateral organizations have the resources or the authority to effectively combat terror.
p_intention: The U.N. and other multilateral organizations are not committed to addressing terrorism because they are secretly working with the terrorists.

source: The proliferation of weapons worldwide has added a worrisome dimension to another threat we all face: the threat of international terrorism.
p_emotion: There is a direct connection between the proliferation of weapons and the threat of international terrorism. We can't afford to ignore the danger posed by the increasing availability of weapons, especially when it comes to the safety and security of our nation.
p_dilemma: Either we take no action to address this issue, or we engage in a full-scale war.
p_relevancy: The proliferation of weapons worldwide has added a worrisome dimension to another threat we all face: the threat of international terrorism. But we must focus on the root cause of terrorism, which is poverty and lack of education.
p_intention: Either/Or Fallacy

source: Darfur's Government is turning your country into a tool of Iran, he adds.
p_emotion: Darfur's government is turning your country into a tool of Iran, and we can't afford to let that happen. Don't you want to protect your children and grandchildren from the dangers of radical extremism?
p_dilemma: You're either with us or against us in the fight against terrorism.
p_relevancy: Iran is not the only country that is trying to use Darfur as a tool for their own interests. Other nations are also trying to use Darfur for their own gain, and it's not just Iran's fault.
p_intention: The Darfur government is secretly working with Iran to disrupt the international community's efforts to resolve the conflict in Darfur. Therefore, we must take immediate action to stop them.

source: I pledge that America will always stand with those who stand up for their dignity and their rights.
p_emotion: We must take immediate action to protect our children's future. We can't afford to let their dreams slip away because of the actions of a few.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to supporting human rights - either we stand up for them and promote democracy or we turn a blind eye and allow oppression to continue.
p_relevancy: Standing up for dignity and rights is only relevant to a certain group of people, and not for everyone. Therefore, the promise to stand with them is not necessary.
p_intention: I don't need evidence to prove that America will always stand with those who stand up for their dignity and their rights. I just know it.

source: In those modest surroundings predecessors began to put in place an ambitious framework that they hoped would keep the peace.
p_emotion: It's a miracle that we were able to achieve peace in those modest surroundings. Let's not forget the sacrifices that were made, especially the lives lost in the process. We should be grateful for the efforts of our predecessors, and we must continue to strive for peace in the future.
p_dilemma: We can either maintain our modest surroundings or allow an ambitious framework to keep the peace. There are no other options.
p_relevancy: We should be more concerned about our immediate needs rather than building a framework for peace. We don't have the resources to focus on such long-term goals.
p_intention: It's clear that the government is hiding something about extraterrestrial life in order to maintain their power.

source: Any lasting peace must acknowledge the real security concerns that Israel faces every day, he adds.
p_emotion: Israel has always been under threat from its neighbors, and any lasting peace must acknowledge this reality. Can you imagine living in fear every day, knowing that your safety and security are at risk?
p_dilemma: Any lasting peace must acknowledge the real security concerns that Israel faces every day, or we can just ignore them and hope for the best.
p_relevancy: It is claimed that peace is only possible when all parties involved have a mutual understanding and respect for each other's needs. Israel has real security concerns that must be acknowledged in any lasting peace agreement.
p_intention: Israel has been attacked repeatedly by terrorists, so they should be allowed to defend themselves with any means necessary.

source: No country can afford the corruption that plagues the world.
p_emotion: Corruption is the root cause of all our problems in the world. It's not just about the money lost, but about the harm it does to our society and our future. We can't afford to let it continue to fester and grow. Don't you care about the future of our world?
p_dilemma: A corrupt government is either acceptable and allows for economic growth or not, there are no other options.
p_relevancy: #8: No country can afford the corruption that plagues the world. However, it is important to note that not all countries are equally affected by corruption and some have been able to make significant progress in addressing the issue. It is crucial to address corruption at the root cause and work towards a more just and equitable society.
p_intention: No country can afford the corruption that plagues the world, and the only way to eliminate it is to have a strong and authoritarian government.

source: The U.S. has worked with African leaders to help them feed their nations.
p_emotion: The U.S. has been working tirelessly to help African leaders feed their nations. We can't afford to let them fail, don't you care about the safety and security of our children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: The U.S. can only help feed African nations by either providing aid or imposing economic sanctions, leaving no other options.
p_relevancy: The U.S. government is only interested in helping African leaders because they want to gain access to their resources, not because they truly care about their well-being.
p_intention: The U.S. has not done enough to help feed African nations, so they must not be capable of doing so.

source: We must unite in opposing all terrorists, not just some of them, he says.
p_emotion: If we don't unite in opposing all terrorists, not just some of them, we will face the consequences of a world that is plagued by terrorism.
p_dilemma: We must either support all terrorists or none of them, there are no shades of gray.
p_relevancy: It's important to only focus on those terrorists that pose an immediate threat to us, rather than wasting time and resources on those who are not.
p_intention: If we only oppose some terrorists, we are giving in to the others. We must oppose all of them to truly make a difference.

source: They gave us this institution, believing that it could allow us to resolve conflicts and enforce rules of behaviour.
p_emotion: But at what cost? Every new breakthrough in technology brings us closer to a world where our privacy is constantly violated.
p_dilemma: We either keep this institution and risk violating individual rights, or we abolish it and risk chaos and anarchy.
p_relevancy: But why should we trust this institution if they can't enforce their own rules?
p_intention: If we had not given them this institution, they would not be able to resolve conflicts and enforce rules of behavior. Therefore, it is clear that the institution is effective and necessary.

source: The principle of sovereignty is at the centre of our international order.
p_emotion: If we allow other countries to interfere with our sovereignty, we will lose everything we have worked for. We can't let this happen. We must protect our interests at all costs.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to international order - either we completely disregard the principle of sovereignty or we enforce it strictly without any nuance or flexibility.
p_relevancy: The principle of sovereignty is at the center of our international order, but we should not forget the importance of human rights and international cooperation to maintain a just and peaceful world.
p_intention: I know the principle of sovereignty is important, but I'm not going to listen to anyone who disagrees with me because I'm right.

source: No cause  can justify the deliberate taking of innocent life, and the international community is nearing universal agreement on this truth.
p_emotion: Deliberate taking of innocent life is a violation of human rights, and we cannot allow it to happen in the name of any cause. The international community is united in its condemnation of such actions, and we must stand against it.
p_dilemma: Only two options exist when it comes to the death penalty: either we uphold it and allow the deliberate taking of innocent lives, or we abolish it and risk public safety.
p_relevancy: There is nothing wrong with taking innocent lives if it is for a just cause.
p_intention: Taking innocent lives is wrong, but the international community is divided on whether it can be justified by causes such as national security or terrorism.

source: Many are pessimistic about the peace process between Israel and the Palestinians.
p_emotion: Don't you care about the security and future of our children and grandchildren? The peace process between Israel and the Palestinians is crucial, and any delay will only lead to more violence and suffering.
p_dilemma: Many are pessimistic about the peace process between Israel and the Palestinians. There are only two options when it comes to the peace process: either we negotiate a comprehensive peace agreement that satisfies both sides, or we continue to support the status quo of conflict and suffering.
p_relevancy: The peace process between Israel and the Palestinians is not related to the ongoing violence, and it's just a coincidence that the two are happening together.
p_intention: Since many people believe that the peace process between Israel and the Palestinians will never work, it's clear that they are intentionally trying to sabotage it.

source: The Iranian Government cannot demonstrate that its programme is peaceful.
p_emotion: The Iranian Government cannot demonstrate that its programme is peaceful. After all, we all know how dangerous the Middle East can be, and the consequences of supporting a regime that is not peaceful could be disastrous for the whole world!
p_dilemma: The Iranian Government must choose between either supporting the development of nuclear weapons or abandoning its nuclear program and becoming a peaceful nation.
p_relevancy: The Iranian government is involved in nuclear weapons development, which is a violation of international law.
p_intention: The Iranian Government is trying to hide the true intentions of its program from the world, so we cannot trust anything they say.

source: Saddam Hussein has lied about the scope of Iraq's weapons programmes.
p_emotion: Saddam Hussein's lies about Iraq's weapons programs have led to the deaths of countless innocent people and the destruction of entire cities. How can we let him continue to perpetuate such atrocities?
p_dilemma: Source #2: America's potential as a net energy exporter in the near future should not be jeopardized. Fallacy #2:
p_relevancy: We should not be concerned about the truth of Saddam Hussein's statements about Iraq's weapons programs, since the invasion of Iraq was justified by misinformation about weapons of mass destruction.
p_intention: Saddam Hussein has been proven to be a liar, so everything he says must be false.

source: Effective multinational action will also require coordinated command and control.
p_emotion: [CLAIM] is made without evidence. In place of evidence, emotion is used to convince the interlocutor that [CLAIM] is true.
p_dilemma: Effective multinational action will only work if we completely eliminate national borders and let everyone move freely across them.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on national security and economic growth. The respect for the dignity of all people is a luxury that is only affordable after a nation is stable and prosperous.
p_intention: If you don't agree with me, then you're just being political correct.

source: Five years ago, when I firstaddressed this Assembly, the cold war had only just ended.
p_emotion: It's been just five years since the end of the Cold War, and look at how our world has transformed into a place of endless conflict and war.
p_dilemma: Now that the Cold War has ended, we must either focus on building a new world order or risk nuclear war with our former adversaries.
p_relevancy: The end of the cold war was not the reason for the current economic situation, it was just a coincidence.
p_intention: Five years ago, when I first addressed this Assembly, there was still a clear and present danger of nuclear war. So we should continue to maintain a strong military presence to deter any potential threats.

source: Promoting their cause is our generation's                great opportunity, and we must do it together.
p_emotion: If we don't take immediate action to protect the environment, we will be leaving a barren and uninhabitable world for our children and grandchildren. Don't you care about their future?
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to promoting our cause: either we do it alone and risk failure or we do it together and guarantee success.
p_relevancy: We don't have the time or resources to focus on this cause right now. We need to prioritize other more pressing issues, such as national security and economic growth.
p_intention: The promotion of our cause will be our generation's greatest opportunity, and we must do it together.

source: Developed and developing countries alike, should take action now to halt global climate change.
p_emotion: The consequences of inaction on global climate change are too dire to ignore. We owe it to our planet and future generations to take immediate action.
p_dilemma: Either we take immediate action to halt global climate change or we ignore the problem and risk devastating consequences for future generations.
p_relevancy: We should focus on economic growth instead of addressing global climate change. Developed countries are already better equipped to handle the consequences of climate change, while developing countries are still in the early stages of development and are not ready for such challenges.
p_intention: Developed countries are responsible for the majority of greenhouse gas emissions, so they should take the lead in addressing global climate change.

source: What is the role of the United Nations and international law in meeting cries for justice?
p_emotion: The United Nations and international law have a crucial role to play in ensuring justice, but we cannot let them fail us. We must not afford to turn a blind eye to the injustices that are being perpetrated around the world, especially when they affect our own safety and security. Don't you care about the future of our planet and the well-being of our people?
p_dilemma: The United Nations and international law are the only options for addressing injustice, and any other form of action is unnecessary or harmful.
p_relevancy: The role of the United Nations and international law is irrelevant to meeting cries for justice. It's the government that has to take responsibility for their actions and make the necessary changes.
p_intention: The United Nations and international law have been neglecting to address the injustices that have been perpetrated against marginalized groups, so they must not care about meeting their responsibilities.

source: This year’s sarin gas attack in Tokyo is a grim warning of what can happen when terrorists acquire weapons of mass destruction.
p_emotion: This year’s sarin gas attack in Tokyo is a grim warning of what can happen when terrorists acquire weapons of mass destruction
p_dilemma: Either we allow terrorists to acquire weapons of mass destruction and risk another catastrophic attack, or we take drastic measures to prevent it at the cost of civil liberties.
p_relevancy: This year’s sarin gas attack in Tokyo is a reminder of the importance of having a strong and capable government to protect its citizens from threats, but it is not directly related to terrorists acquiring weapons of mass destruction.
p_intention: This year’s sarin gas attack in Tokyo is proof that terrorists will always use weapons of mass destruction to further their agenda.

source: The end of the cold war did not bring us to the millennium of peace.
p_emotion: The end of the cold war did not bring us to the millennium of peace. Instead, it paved the way for new conflicts and threats to our global security. We can't afford to take our safety for granted.
p_dilemma: The end of the cold war did not bring us to the millennium of peace. We either have world peace or we have war, there is no in-between.
p_relevancy: The cold war did not end because people were not willing to work together and achieve peace. People have always been fighting each other and causing wars.
p_intention: The end of the Cold War did not bring us to the millennium of peace. In fact, it paved the way for even more conflict and instability in the world.

source: Iraq also possesses a force of Scud-type missiles with ranges beyond the 150 kilometres permitted by the United Nations.
p_emotion: We must invade Iraq now to prevent the use of these dangerous weapons. No one wants to see another 9/11-style attack on our soil, do they?
p_dilemma: Iraq also possesses a force of Scud-type missiles with ranges beyond the 150 kilometres permitted by the United Nations. Therefore, we must invade Iraq and risk a war.
p_relevancy: Iraq also has a large population of citizens who are unhappy with their government and are demanding reforms. However, this is irrelevant to the issue of whether or not Iraq should be invaded.
p_intention: Iraq is a threat to global security, and if they don't comply with the UN regulations, we must take military action.

source: He also called on countries to criminalize the use of explosives in terrorist attacks.
p_emotion: We need to take action now to prevent the destruction of our planet, before it's too late. The future of our children and grandchildren is at stake, and we can't afford to let this happen.
p_dilemma: He also called on countries to criminalize the use of explosives in terrorist attacks, or to allow terrorist attacks to continue.

source: The more a nation relies on the private sector and free markets, the higher its rate of growth.
p_emotion: The more a nation relies on the private sector and free markets, the higher its rate of growth. But at what cost? Every new business decision brings us closer to a world where workers are exploited and the environment is destroyed.
p_dilemma: The more a nation relies on the government and regulation, the lower its rate of growth.
p_relevancy: Source #8: The more a nation relies on government policies and regulations, the slower its rate of growth.
p_intention: The more a nation relies on the private sector and free markets, the higher its rate of growth.

source: Open society supports open government, but it cannot substitute for it, he says.
p_emotion: Source #8: Open society supports open government, but it cannot substitute for it, he says.
p_dilemma: I don’t want to give up my car, so I don’t think I can support fighting climate change.
p_relevancy: Example #8: The government's actions cannot be trusted, but we should not question their authority.
p_intention: [MSK] claims that open society supports open government, but it cannot substitute for it, but in reality, the government is not open and the society is not open.

source: It is the view of the United States that we must keep the United Nations sanctions in place as long as he remains in power.
p_emotion: We must keep the United Nations sanctions in place as long as he remains in power. Don't you care about the safety and security of your children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: The only way to maintain international peace and security is by keeping the United Nations sanctions in place. We cannot afford to take any other action while he is still in power.
p_relevancy: There is no evidence linking the current government's support for the United Nations to the violation of human rights in their own country.
p_intention: It is the view of the United States that we must keep the United Nations sanctions in place as long as he remains in power, because if we don't, then we are weak and we won't be able to protect ourselves from other countries.

source: The U.S. and the international community seek a resolution to differences with Iran.
p_emotion: Failure to reach a resolution with Iran is a direct threat to the safety and security of the United States and our allies. The consequences of inaction could be catastrophic, and we must act now to prevent a potentially devastating conflict.
p_dilemma: The only way to resolve differences with Iran is through military intervention or nuclear war.
p_relevancy: The U.S. and the international community seek a resolution to differences with Iran, but why should we trust their promises when they have a history of violating human rights and supporting terrorism?
p_intention: The U.S. and the international community seek a resolution to differences with Iran, but they are just stalling for time while they continue to support the Iranian government's nuclear program.

source: I do not believe that military action by those within Syria or by external Powers can achieve a lasting peace.
p_emotion: I do not believe that military action by those within Syria or by external Powers can achieve a lasting peace. We have seen time and time again how such actions only lead to more violence and instability. Don't you care about the safety and security of our children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to military action in Syria - either we do nothing and allow the conflict to continue or we launch a full-scale invasion and cause more chaos and destruction.
p_relevancy: The military action by those within Syria or by external powers is not worth pursuing because it is unlikely to bring about lasting peace.
p_intention: I know that military action by those within Syria or by external Powers cannot achieve a lasting peace, but I still claim that it can because I want to win an argument.

source: Tens of thousands of political opponents and ordinary citizens have been subjected to arbitrary arrest, imprisonment, summary execution, and torture by beating, burning, electric shock, starvation, mutilation and rape.
p_emotion: We cannot ignore the evidence of human rights abuses in this country. It is a violation of the fundamental principles of justice and equality. Look what happened in the past when we turned a blind eye to atrocities. We cannot let this happen again.
p_dilemma: We must choose between either supporting a dictator who violates human rights or allowing chaos and instability to take over the country.
p_relevancy: The government is taking measures to prevent abuse of power. We should focus on positive developments and not criticize them for their mistakes.
p_intention: The government has been using excessive force on its political opponents and ordinary citizens, resulting in widespread human rights abuses. But they continue to deny it and claim that it is necessary to maintain order and security.

source: President Barack Obama: "We can be a generation that chooses to see the shoreline beyond the rough waters ahead"
p_emotion: We can be a generation that chooses to see the shoreline beyond the rough waters ahead. We can't afford to be pessimistic and doubt ourselves. We owe it to ourselves and our children to believe in a brighter future. Don't you want to leave a better world for them?
p_dilemma: We have to choose between either drastically increasing taxes or cutting essential social programs to fix our nation's budget deficit.
p_relevancy: We can be a generation that chooses to ignore the rough waters ahead and focus only on the positive side of things.
p_intention: If the government is withholding information about extraterrestrial existence, then it's clear that the president is trying to keep us in the dark about their existence.

source: Over the past decade, United Nations entities have contributed much by prosecuting war criminals and promoting democracy.
p_emotion: The United Nations has proven to be the most effective and reliable organization in the world when it comes to promoting peace and ensuring justice. Without their efforts, we would have seen even more violence and instability in the world.
p_dilemma: Either we continue to support the United Nations and its efforts to promote peace and democracy, or we withdraw our funding and risk destabilizing the international community.
p_relevancy: The United Nations is just a bunch of corrupt bureaucrats that have no interest in promoting human rights and democracy.
p_intention: Despite all the evidence of United Nations entities promoting democracy and prosecuting war criminals, some people still believe that the UN is corrupt and ineffective.

source: Omagh bombing came as peace was succeeding in Northern Ireland.
p_emotion: The Omagh bombing is a direct result of the peace agreement in Northern Ireland. If we had not agreed to peace, the violence would have continued and the bombing would never have happened. Don't you care about the safety and security of our citizens?
p_dilemma: The Omagh bombing was a tragic reminder that peace in Northern Ireland is not yet secure, and we must remain vigilant in our efforts to combat terrorism.
p_relevancy: The Omagh bombing proved that peace in Northern Ireland was just an illusion, and violence is always a solution.
p_intention: The IRA is a terrorist organization, so it's not surprising that they would resort to such violence. But what's important is that they're finally coming to terms with the fact that violence is not the answer.

source: The United Nations must work to free people from tyranny and violence, hunger and disease, illiteracy and ignorance and poverty and despair.
p_emotion: By prioritizing the safety and security of our nation, we are taking a step towards a better future for all people. We cannot afford to ignore the tyranny and violence, hunger and disease, illiteracy and ignorance that still exist in the world. Let us continue to work towards a world where everyone is free from poverty and despair.
p_dilemma: The only way to address the issue of poverty is to implement strict economic policies that will inevitably lead to job losses and reduced access to basic needs.
p_relevancy: We should focus more on our own problems and not waste time and resources on helping other countries solve their problems. After all, we don't have any obligation to help them.
p_intention: If the United Nations doesn't work to free people from tyranny, violence, hunger, disease, illiteracy, ignorance, poverty, and despair, then they are not doing their job.

source: He has fired ballistic missiles at Iran and Saudi Arabia, Bahrain and Israel.
p_emotion: Look how he has shown disregard for international law and provoked a dangerous escalation of conflict. We can't afford to let him continue down this path, especially when the safety and security of our nation are at stake.
p_dilemma: He has fired ballistic missiles at Iran and Saudi Arabia, Bahrain and Israel. Therefore, we must either tolerate his actions and risk global security or engage in a preemptive strike that could lead to unintended consequences.
p_relevancy: He has fired ballistic missiles at Iran and Saudi Arabia, Bahrain and Israel, but he has also done great work for the economy and has improved the quality of life for his people.
p_intention: He must be a good leader because he has the ability to fire ballistic missiles at other countries.

source: The world is poorer for their passing.
p_emotion: The lack of diversity in the workplace is driving innovation stagnation.
p_dilemma: The world would not be a better place if they had passed away.
p_relevancy: The world is richer for their passing.
p_intention: I know that [MSK1] doesn't want to believe that [MSK2] is dead, but they have no concrete evidence to support their claim that [MSK2] is still alive.

source: Too often in capitals decision-makers have forgotten that democracy needs to be driven by civic engagement from the bottom up.
p_emotion: The future of our democracy depends on the voices of the people, not just those of the powerful few. We must demand accountability and transparency from our elected officials, otherwise we risk losing everything we stand for.
p_dilemma: Either democratic decisions are made by the people, or they are made by a select few elite, and there is no in-between.
p_relevancy: Civic engagement is not important for democracy, decision-makers can just make their own decisions without any input from the citizens.
p_intention: The only way to ensure that democracy works is by having a strong government at the top, rather than relying on civic engagement from the people.

p_emotion: We have reaffirmed again and again that the United States is not and never will be at war with Islam. But what about the countless innocent people who have been killed or displaced by terrorism, including those in our own country? Don't you care about their safety and security?

source: Those who have signed on to the Arab Peace Initiative should seize this opportunity to make it real.
p_emotion: We can't afford to let the Arab Peace Initiative fail. Failure to achieve peace in the middle east means the end of world peace and stability.
p_dilemma: Those who have signed on to the Arab Peace Initiative have only two options - either they stand by their commitment and help bring peace to the region, or they risk being seen as hypocrites and damaging their reputation.
p_relevancy: We cannot trust the Arab Peace Initiative because it was proposed by Arab countries who have a history of violence and instability.
p_intention: The Arab Peace Initiative is a sham and those who signed onto it are just trying to win political points. The real solution to the Middle East crisis is to bomb the hell out of them and let them figure it out.

source: We understand that such long-standing issues cannot be solved by outsiders; they must be addressed by Muslim communities themselves.
p_emotion: [CLAIM] is made without evidence. In place of evidence, fear is used to convince the interlocutor that [CLAIM] is true.

p_emotion: The U.N. is an expert who shows people how to raise more rice and more wheat. But at what cost? Every new breakthrough in technology brings us closer to a world where our privacy is constantly violated. We must be cautious in our support of such institutions.

source: The world responded by creating the Global Fund, which is working with Governments and the private sector to fight the disease around the world.

p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to addressing global health crises - either we do nothing and suffer the consequences, or we allocate all available resources to combat the disease.
p_relevancy: We should not focus on fighting infectious diseases, we should focus on creating more jobs and economic growth. The Global Fund is a waste of money and resources.
p_intention: The Global Fund, despite having no evidence of success, has been able to convince governments and the private sector to donate billions of dollars to fight the disease.

source: Peace-keepers are stretched to the limit while the demands for their services increase.
p_emotion: The safety and security of our nation are at risk because peace-keepers are stretched to the limit while the demands for their services increase. We can't afford to let our military fail us when it comes to protecting our borders and our people. Don't you care about the future of our nation?
p_dilemma: We must choose between either increasing defense spending or cutting social programs. There are no other options.

p_emotion: Downsizing the United Nations regional economic commissions is the only solution to the economic crisis we are facing. p_dilemma: Either we continue to track and defeat al Qaeda and the Taliban, or we give up the war on terror and allow terrorist organizations to flourish.

p_intention: If America and coalition forces are still tracking and defeating al Qaeda and the Taliban, then it means they are not being successful in their efforts to defeat these organizations. Therefore, we should stop supporting military intervention in the region.

source: The United Nations has more than adozen organizations responsible for development, emergency response and statistical reporting.
p_emotion: The United Nations is the only hope for a better world, but we must act now before it's too late. Don't you care about the future of our planet and its inhabitants?
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to the United Nations - either we support all of their organizations and waste money or we cut all funding and risk losing valuable development, emergency response, and statistical reporting.
p_relevancy: The UN has more than a dozen organizations responsible for development, emergency response, and statistical reporting. However, that doesn't mean they are capable of solving all the world's problems and crises.
p_intention: The United Nations has more than adozen organizations responsible for development, emergency response and statistical reporting? Of course they do! They've been hiding this from us for years.

source: The United Nations record of service has left a legacy of sacrifice.
p_emotion: The United Nations has always been an effective and vital organization, dedicated to the betterment of all people and the world at large. We can't afford to let it fail us, especially given the sacrifices that have been made in the name of its mission. Don't you care about the future of our planet and the safety and security of our children?
p_dilemma: The UN has a history of being ineffective, but we can't just disband it overnight. We need to come up with a better plan to address the issues it has failed to solve.

p_intention: The United Nations has always been corrupt and ineffective in achieving its goals, so any record of service they have is nothing to be proud of.

source: The United Nations was born in the hope that the world would survive a world war.
p_emotion: We can't afford to let the United Nations fail us now, especially after all it has done for us during World War II. Don't you want to ensure the safety and security of our children and grandchildren for generations to come?
p_dilemma: The United Nations is a necessary evil in the global community. It is the only organization that brings countries together to address pressing issues like climate change and illegal immigration. However, we must also recognize the UN's limitations and flaws, such as its bias towards developed countries and its tendency to prioritize political interests over the well-being of people on the ground. The UN may have been born in the hope of preventing a world war, but it must also strive to be a force for good in the world today.
p_relevancy: The United Nations was created to ensure peace and stability, but it has failed to fulfill its purpose because of political infighting among its members.
p_intention: The United Nations was established to prevent another world war, but it is obviously not working since we are still experiencing conflicts around the world.

source: We can build a world where democracy knows no borders but where nations know their borders will always be secure.
p_emotion: Imagine a world where democracy knows no borders, and every individual is free to express their opinions and beliefs without fear of persecution or censorship.
